title: Google Maps
description:
Navigate your world faster and easier with Google Maps. Over 220 countries and territories mapped and hundreds of millions of businesses and places on the map. Get real-time GPS navigation, traffic, and transit info, and find what you need by getting the latest information on businesses, including grocery stores, pharmacies and other important places.

Get where you need to go efficiently:
‚Ä¢ Find the best route with automatic rerouting based on live traffic, incidents, and road closure

Find important businesses:
‚Ä¢ Know what‚Äôs open in your area and their latest business hours
‚Ä¢ Find local restaurants offering delivery and takeout
‚Ä¢ Create lists of your important places 

Get there faster with real-time updates
‚Ä¢ Beat traffic with real-time ETAs and traffic conditions
‚Ä¢ Catch your bus, train, or ride-share with real-time transit info
‚Ä¢ Save time with automatic rerouting based on live traffic, incidents, and road closure
‚Ä¢ With Live View in Google Maps, see the way you need to go with arrows and directions placed right on top of your world. There‚Äôs no second guessing or missing another turn.

More experiences on Google Maps
‚Ä¢ Offline maps to search and navigate without an internet connection
‚Ä¢ Street View and indoor imagery for restaurants, shops, museums and more
‚Ä¢ Indoor maps to quickly find your way inside big places like airports, malls and stadiums

Some features not available in all countries

Navigation isn't intended to be used by oversized or emergency vehicles
releaseNotes: Thanks for using Google Maps! This release brings bug fixes that improve our product to help you discover new places and navigate to them.

title: OOO - Trusted Travel Tips
description:
Out Of Office (OOO) is a recommendation app that allows you to see travel ideas and inspiration from people you know and trust.

PERSONALIZED RECOMMENDATIONS: Answer a short quiz and help us give you personalized travel recommendations. 

CONNECT WITH FRIENDS: Find friends in the app and invite your contacts to join your inner circle.

ADD YOUR RECOMMENDATIONS: Add any recommendation from your travels to our platform so your followers can see where you went and what you liked

SAVE FUTURE TRAVEL INSPO: Wishlist any places and recommendations that you want to remember to inspire future travel.
releaseNotes: We've upgraded our search functionality to help you find that perfect place. Integrated with Booking.com for smoother hotel booking experiences.
reviews:
I‚Äôm struggling to find places in the app. Things like local restaurants and even museums are ‚Äúnot found‚Äù. | Cool app and an upgrade from Yelp, specifically geared to travelers. Ability to find community through recommendations and get a real time look in at what people are doing across the world. | Explain for the life of me why Philadelphia is not listed. I see South Philadelphia and Philadelphia county and someplace called new Philadelphia. I don‚Äôt see Center City Philadelphia or just simply Philadelphia in general I don‚Äôt understand. | This app has a great concept for planning trips, however is very slow when searching destinations to add. | Very glitchy - takes a long time to load. Shows all results of things to do, after you put in the location, to places in completely different countries!! | The map feature only shows you the most recent 10 recommendations. To see them all I have to scroll and load each recommendation which takes FOREVER. And when I click into any recommendation, I lose my place and have to start over. So it‚Äôs virtually impossible for me to actually see all my recommendations laid out. So disappointing, I‚Äôll have to just use google maps | Before you begin there is a short questionnaire which asks who you are traveling with. I put family and children, yet when I inserted my travel destination and had an itinerary generated, it recommended things that were not kid friendly.

Additionally, the questionnaire asks what your budget looks like. Although I chose the lowest bracket, it recommended five star restaurants that were completely unaffordable for me. 

There were a couple hidden gems in the recommendations, but overall it isn‚Äôt worth the space it would take up on my phone unless some more moms joined the community to beef up the kid and budget friendly recommendations. | Looking for a great planning tool that allows you to share with others in your group. This is the one, nice layout and many recommendations for your area of stay. | I could not for the life of me figure out how to see any reviews for places in a city. Whoever designed the ui for this app should be fired. | I want to live this app but it‚Äôs certainly glitching on me. I‚Äôm clicking on what I know is a restaurant I have saved in San Fran and it‚Äôs saying it‚Äôs a beach. | Great to find people who like what you like, so you can get a better idea of what you may like in new places.

I‚Äôve added a bunch, and the location are off. For example, upstate NY is occasionally included in NYC and 2 of my Japanese restaurants in NYC are being listed as a cathedral location. | I love the concept of the app, but some features don‚Äôt work or don‚Äôt have a real purpose. It‚Äôs really hard to just search an area without looking at someone else‚Äôs list. When you search something and add it to a list, the UI just throws you back to a random place and you have to start your search over again. Needs some work on user experience, but I‚Äôll keep using and hope bugs get fixed! | People use Apple Maps for the same use as an app like this. This is just a places finder. So no point and not recommended. | So excited to use this app! Look me up and share your travel tips! @bohemianspirit | I love this app‚Äîso helpful for planning trips! If I have one suggestions, it‚Äôs that I wish you could add comments/reminders to yourself when you add a place to a trip (e.g., what dish everyone loves at a restaurant). I think you can‚Äôt add notes like that when you‚Äôre planning, only once you‚Äôve marked it as a recommendation. | I use OOO both for finding new restaurants and as a quasi-travel diary so when I go back to a city I can remember my own favorites! 

With fake reviews / AI seeming to be on the rise on other sites, it‚Äôs fantastic that OOO allows you to filter by reviews of people you know. | I love this app, but I think it‚Äôs going to take some updates and improvement before this app becomes trendy. Users should be able to categorize places manually because some of them are incorrect‚Äîe.g., it lists one of my hotels as something to ‚Äúdo‚Äù instead of as a place to stay‚Äîand there is no way to change it. I also saved a recommendation in Utah and it is showing up as a location in Michigan. But I would love to see this app grow and for more people to start using it, it has such awesome potential!! | You‚Äôre only able to make itineraries with limited items. I work really hard to find hidden gems so it doesn‚Äôt really make sense that I can make an itinerary using only the most popular spots | The best way to make the perfect itinerary for all your stops & trips üòç | Love all the features so far, but how can I make a reservation as I don‚Äôt see how you do it using open table. Is a booking feature coming soon? | Not only is the brand name perfect. I love how the app is designed and it‚Äôs features. I can definitely see this app being a must have for travellers with a few extra features. 
I use it to plan my trips and save my must go to places. It‚Äôs been super handy! 

I would love to see a option on the trips section to share the itinerary via PDF. I can imagine it would look perfect to share with friends who don‚Äôt use the app or if you are planning a trip for a family member. 

Keep up the great work! I‚Äôm a super fan! Finally an app that not only is pretty but also super useful ü´∂üèº | I love this app. Just starting to use it and I am in love with the My trips part of it. Love being able to add places of interest with times for each day! The only thing is that some of the places I rec show incorrect info on my page. I recommended a place in Utah Wyoming and the final place on my place is showing Ann Arbor, MI. Another is showing incorrect town with a picture that had nothing to do with my review.  Also the feedback does not work on the app. Unable to send any feedback. | EDITS:
Would also love to see the ability to add a ‚Äúmanual‚Äù item- for example: hop-on, hop-off bus tours. Would be super helpful to leave a review and just save my pictures and notes from the experience for keepsakes.

This could easily be the next big social media craze, especially with travel coming back! I love the concept: plan and document all my trips in one place, with ability to recap them in the perfect mix of photos and written descriptions, WITH A SCHEDULE :) so I can easily pass down detailed plans. Amazing. BUT, there are definitely features missing before it can go viral‚Ä¶ I‚Äôd love to see: - The ability to add photos to a place just for you/even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äúrec‚Äù a place, so I don‚Äôt have to post personal pictures to the internet if I want to use it like a social network with a cute recap of me and my partner on a trips‚Äô pictures for our friends and family. This would go along great with better privacy/sharing settings, so I can share my trips and photos and comments/notes with people, allow others to add comments who are tripmates and maybe a ‚Äúview only‚Äù tier with public/private comments for what I want a friend to be able to see (if someone from work asks for trip recs, but maybe I don‚Äôt want them to see my reservation notes on a place but do want them to see my review). | As a travel agent, I LOVE using this app to build trips for my clients. Once all of your activities/hotels/restaurants are loaded, my clients are able to click on the itinerary and everything shows up on the map in their app, which saves them  TONS of time from having to Google everything individually outside the app. Super trendy, modern, and unique recs from all the users. Such a fun travel space to be in! | Amazing for travels recs and finding new places.  I‚Äôve been sending lists of my recs for years and now this makes it so much easier to share with friends! | I hope more people use it, such a cool idea | A really awesome function that should be incorporated in to this beautiful app would be a visually appealing countdown feature for ‚ÄúMy Trips‚Äù. A bonus would be the ability to create a Home Screen widget for your countdown as well! | So much potential. I got so excited for this app and to use it but has a few problems. This is my first ever review on here because guess what? Your feedback option does not work. You click on submit and does nothing. Do you guys not test your app after updates?
Also, does anybody who works for this app ever use it at all? If so, you can easily catch the glitches and what needs to be fixed. For example, when you click the ‚Äúback‚Äù button, it doesn‚Äôt really go back to the previous page you‚Äôre on. When i am checking out another person‚Äôs profile, clicks on their recs, and then tries to go to back to their page, it doesn‚Äôt. It leads me back to my profile! It is so annoying. Please fix this. The app is way too focused on ‚Äúaesthetic‚Äù but has no quality. Way too many problems. | I love this ap!! I love having lists for all my trips in one place, love the aesthetic, & the map feature ! 

I would LOVE to be able to make my own notes for businesses that only I can see. That way any research I‚Äôve done on the place can be there too. For example- a place that doesn‚Äôt take reservations for breakfast, I‚Äôd like to note that :) | Love the look and design of this app, and the concept and information you get for trips is amazing!! Really helpful to create your own trip folders or wishlists all in one place with pictures, location etc etc. convenient and helpful to get you to all the places you‚Äôre wanting! 

The docked star is due to some interface annoyances through using the app. When clicking into someone‚Äôs recommendation from a trip and clicking the back arrow it brings you all the way back to the search page rather than that person‚Äôs trip to continue looking through their reccos. So you have to find your way back to where you were if you want to continue browsing. | Love this concept and the ease of use of the app. As a business owner, I wish there was a way we could edit information that isn‚Äôt correct, such as hours of operation. I understand the concept is for this to be different than Yelp, just wish we could provide accurate information. | This app is a beautiful way to plan trips and to remember past trips. | So helpful to see hometown recommendations! Love love love this app and can‚Äôt wait to see all the new features that get added üôåüèΩ | As someone who loves traveling and giving recs, this is perfect. Still needs some things worked out,   Like my profile picture and background photo do not load or show? probably a bug issue. Also I would love it if you were able to have a tab with a grid of all the photos you‚Äôve took at locations, similar to Instagram, and the ability to change the main photo on your profile of trip locations. Otherwise great app can would love to see this grow | While I‚Äôm pretty proud of the state of my travel spreadsheets, this app blows them away. The social aspect, easily saving and sharing ideas with friends, make planning so much easier. | Pros:
+ GPS enabled search
+ Clean, intuitive functions
+ Collaborative space

Cons:
- does not map from location to location
- there‚Äôs no default view of a trip to show the entire itinerary, you have you click day by day 
- you can‚Äôt share trips to Instagram stories, there should be an attractive easy display for sharing on social media 
- there is no FAQ or feedback section in the app to suggest changes 
- you cannot make notes about a location or place you select for your trip, therefore I still prefer using notes over this app until it adds features

I am happy to use this app for an upcoming trip and will provide an updated review if the app features are updated. | I love this concept! The app is super easy to navigate and fun to use. I love logging all of the places I‚Äôve been to, because it both helps give people I know recommendations, and it gives me a nice memory bank of where I‚Äôve been. I used this to plan a recent trip, and it was such a neat way to keep track of where I wanted to go and what I wanted to do. Love the map feature to see where in a city my friend‚Äôs recommendations are, and to find where my next stop is on vacation! | Love all the features so far. Genius idea!! When I‚Äôm planning trips, especially international trips, I use google maps to organize the itinerary based on location and proximity. I‚Äôm def gonna start inviting friends to join to make our lives easier. 
 For more effective itinerary planning, I would suggest adding the following:
1. Times
2. Option to add attachments, videos or images because some of the images don‚Äôt do these places justice)
3. Finally notes within scheduled places (as shown in the previews) and also notes to add activities that are not listed. 

I also love how the map shows the proximity of places to each other but is it possible to add a feature where we can see the actual distance from one place to another and perhaps driving directions? Currently, google maps only opens for directions to one place. | truly changes the game | Really great concept and I love the user friendliness. However, each time I try to see a list of someone‚Äôs recs on their page (or even my own), the recs do not load. The only way I can see recs is by searching a city right now. Needs an update probably

UPDATE: it works fine. This ^ was only happening for a few hours the first day. Really cool app! | Great for planning trips and sharing recommendations with friends! | It‚Äôs so awesome that you can put locations on the day you plan to visit but why not add time? It‚Äôs not a full function collaboration or trip planing tool if you can‚Äôt plan times in your day. | Cool app. Will definitely be using in future travels. Just wish there was an option to add your own photos and notes. Could possibly make this option private or public for others to see. | There are many things I love about this app. I just started using ‚Äúplan my trip‚Äù.  
Not only am I adding all the places/ things I want to do as I prepare but this will also serve as a record for me for future,  Have u ever tried to remember that little restaurant you had stumbled across but couldn‚Äôt. Just park it here. | Love the app, such a great concept, very user friendly, and very great aesthetically. Just one thing- please make an update where you can make folders within each city of recommendations so that we can distinguish between food recs/activities/shopping, etc. Right now they are all in one category under each city and I‚Äôm afraid my recommendations will get lost in the sauce and get confusing if I keep adding to it! Would love a bit of organization and categories within each city. Thank you! | I‚Äôm already obsessed with the app as-is. It‚Äôs been. A very practical, helpful tool for trip research & planning - especially for group trips with friends or family. I don‚Äôt have a ton of friends on the app yet, so my planning process is still to go to Pinterest or travel blogs for ideas and then I save my wishlist things to do in Out of Office. If they keep building out additional features that make it more useful, building a user base I want to follow, and create more opportunities for engagement across users, this app will be an absolutely must have for anyone who enjoys a trip! | I love to see what friends and influencers that I follow are doing when they travel. Places to stay, eat, sights to see! I sometimes DM people and ask but this makes it so much easier especially when planning a trip and giving others recommendations. 10/10 recommend! | This is hands down one of the most beneficial travel apps I have ever used. For someone who loves to travel the reviews and recommendations have been spot on! Can‚Äôt wait to use the app on my next trip! | A user friendly interface that‚Äôs so easy to use! And because I trust my friends (and some influencers), it makes picking my hotel or restaurant so simple! Why didn‚Äôt someone think of this sooner? (Love the name, btw) | The reviews and recommendations have been great - love being able to follow friends (and their friends) and family and get their advice on where to eat, stay, and visit. Much , much better than the other travel info sources available where random people give input. Already using it for planning vacations and also for enjoying the city I live in - finding new places right in my own town I had never heard abou!!!

title: Go City -Travel Plan & Tickets
description:
New home for The New York Pass¬Æ and The London Pass¬Æ
- Use your Go City App for your The New York Pass¬Æ or The London Pass¬Æ purchases and enjoy a richer app experience. 

One pass, all the sights. 

Sightseeing just got easier. With Go City, enjoy the best attractions, experiences and tours a city has to offer, all on one pass. Download the app to explore over 30 destinations, check out our incredible attraction line-up and access your digital pass for easy entry.

Using the Go City app, you can:

Explore attractions
- Read up on all the experiences available on your pass.  
- Find out opening hours, reservation info and how to get there.

Sightsee using Map View
- Use Map View to find nearby attractions when you're on the go.

Smart trip planning
- Simply pick your must-see attractions and let the trip planning tool do the rest.
- Make best use of your time in the city with optimised plans.

Access your pass
- Download your pass to the app and show it at each attraction ‚Äì it's that easy!
- Available offline ‚Äì so no more Wi-Fi worries!
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements.
reviews:
When you pay $1000 you shouldn‚Äôt have to read the EXTRA fine print. The ad states that time begins after scanning the the 1st attraction. Our tickets ended at midnight the next day. We were cut off the next day at midnight. Deceitful practices | We did the 2 day pass.. family of 6.. did Universal on day 1.. you have to reserve the morning of the day you plan to visit.. did it, they scanned my phone, no problems.. second day kids wanted to do knotts.. you have to show your passes at both 11/ 12 and they exchange for paper tickets.. same thing, no issues.. highly recommend! Saved so much money! Just pay attention to which attraction you want and follow their admittance rules and you‚Äôll be fine.. will be purchasing again wherever we go!! | This has been nothing but a headache we purchased discounted tickets through Groupon and it was horrible. You can‚Äôt reach anybody on Groupon only through a text it took me an hour back-and-forth to get the right confirmation code and then we made reservations for Statue of Liberty and only a couple reservations went through. It has been nothing but a headache. I suggest go straight through Go City, and I actually talk to a human that will help you guide you all this hassle. Just save a couple dollars is not worth it. | The older version can add attraction to a specific date with Morning, Afternoon and evening option. Now, all selected events are unscheduled and cannot do anything else. Need to fix this! | one day only 2 attractions, almost same price for two regular price, but on your own pace and condition, | They have a ‚Äúsavings guarantee‚Äù but it‚Äôs only if you book 3x a day which is virtually impossible. I used it for 3 days to get premium offers. One of them cancelled on me due to weather. I did the math and I would have saved money if I would have booked everything individually 2 events a day. | Lousy info and customer service | Information on their website is outdated and the customer service is lousy | Don‚Äôt even think about using this service. They are overpricing. I bought the tickets for Rome for 3 activities worth $100 and the total entry fee for the very same tickets if bought individually were less than $50. They claim they give you up to 35% which is a flat out lie. | ‚ÄúIf it is too good to be true, it probably is‚Äù. At first look you would feel they provide better value for money. However, most attractions will treat you like a freeloader. I took a two say pass for miami. And the pass stated ‚Äújust show up and show the pass‚Äù. But Most of the good attractions mentioned they only allow limited people from gocity pass. That means each day, if you go early, you can get one to one good attraction and by the time you finish it all the other ones are sold out. Their customer service is horrible and do not honor the misleading claims stated in the pass. They offered us a partial refund provided we go to multiple attractions and prove that none of them is accepting go city pass. That makes no sense given our valuable time of lost in the process. That said, it is still worth it if you plan to go to multiple attractions. I got a 50% discount on the pass. So covering 4 attractions from the list of 40+ attractions (some are far away from miami and some are not worth your time) will make up for the cost. So plan to book and pay directly for the main attractions like speedboat and if you did end up taking a pass, use it for the less popular attractions. Always call ahead and try to book it as much as possible. | Don‚Äôt buy the pass the day you arrive thinking you can use it. It apparently has to go through security checks which takes about 6 hours so now we are here waiting with nothing to do since this was our plan today. I called and they ‚Äúflagged our order‚Äù to be processed sooner but still will take hours. Absolutely ridiculous!!! They don‚Äôt advertise this and I‚Äôve been to many other cities using go passes and never had to wait to receive it! | Made accessing attractions quick and easy | The app is glitchy. On initial load- the app looks like it‚Äôs struggling to refresh and it‚Äôs stuck on a loop doing so. | Everything tells you to make a reservation right? You can only do it same day. Customer service is non existent, I‚Äôve seen 5 year olds with better manners and customer service skills.
Was told no problem as soon as we get confirmation you didn‚Äôt go we will redo the tickets. No call, no email. I called back to be told they can not help me. HORRIBLE DO NOT USE! | When you open the map it opens the wrong address. Made us miss a cruise. | We just got 4 go city passes for 3 things to do and in an hour and a half they now say expired and we haven‚Äôt even used them once | Title says it all, planned a vacation around a cruise but they had no indication that it was close for the entire weekend we went. Probably won‚Äôt use it again. | I saw the promises this app made and was skeptical; it just sounded too good to be true. This app is 100% worth getting. We were able to save $50 with this (we did the 2 day all inclusive). Absolutely get this app if you can | I and my family used the All Inclusive pass and had a blast in Boston!!! We went through sooooooooo many places and there was no hassle of waiting in line or worry about ticket.
The best thing about this was after the whole trip, I calculated the saving of about $1200.
Yeah, next trip to Hawaii!!!!!!!üòÜüòÜ | Lowered the review because it asks to rate all the time | I have had nothing but problems using this app! | Tried to purchase from their website, won‚Äôt accept payment.  Called the help line, they said use the ap they apparently no longer accept web payments.   Used the ap, get ‚Äúunknown failure‚Äù message with 2 different credit cards.   Guess my money is not worthy of their product. | Could have bought tickets cheaper on my own! | Can‚Äôt sync my passes to my email or app. | This pass is useless in Amsterdam. The pass doesn't book tickets so you have to make reservation online with the sites, but you can't pay for the reservations with the pass. Either you chance it and hope that when you arrive you can get in with your pass, or you pay separately and the pass is worthless. DO NOT go without reservations because you will not get in. The sites cost less than the pass in total. And the ferry to the castle was closed entirely so we got stuck 10 miles from the castle without a way back. The Uber cost $70 round trip. Absolutely a waste of money. | A huge portion of the activities were unavailable in general but you don‚Äôt find this out till after you purchase and try to make reservations.   Then overnight 1/4 of the remaining options disappeared.  Our premium activity was cancelled by the vendor 10 minutes prior to our reservation and they won‚Äôt reschedule or refund, of course on GoCity it shows up as utilized. | Bought this pass as it said I could choose from the San Diego Zoo or Adventure Park (not both). Fine with me as we were only planning to go to the zoo. Once paid for, neither was an option. What a rip off! | The app is easy to use and pretty simple | This has the option to add activities to an itinerary, but I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to view that itinerary after adding activities to it. I eventually figured out that if I add activities to my ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù instead, I was able to see a list of favorites.

The favorites button is a white button which is displayed on top of an image of the activity. Unfortunately one of the activities I wanted to add to my favorites had an image that was white too in the area where the favorite button was (white on white) so I had no idea whether I was successfully tapping the favorites button. I eventually figured out that I could tap where I thought the favorites button probably was and then go to my favorites list and check if the activity was listed in my favorites‚Ä¶nope, not there. So I tried again‚Ä¶That time it worked.

So after some trial and error I got this to work acceptably to be able to see a list of the activities I plan to do and tap on them to get directions to them. It would be helpful to have these things improved though. | We had a two day pass. We saved $147 each above what we paid for the pass. We used the app and just presented our passes on my phone and in we went. No problems. Probably got to do and see more because we didn‚Äôt worry about needing to spend all day at the aquarium to ‚Äúget our money‚Äôs worth‚Äù, for example. | Best bang for your buck when it comes to bundling deals AND saves you money in the end. The Inclusive pass is where it‚Äôs at. | These passes are great. Saves time having to order at every individual attraction & money‚Ä¶ one set price for all depending on the number of attractions. The difference between all inclusive & explorer is‚Ä¶ inclusive pass gives you 35 attractions for a set amount of days while explorer pass allows you to experience the number of attractions over several days/weeks. I chose explorer. üòç | Es mejor comprar por separado tus sitios de inter√©s, no es m√°s econ√≥mico comprarlo con esta aplicaci√≥n. Compre 10 atracciones y solo pude disfrutar de 6. Luego no hay forma de tener atenci√≥n al cliente, no hay quien resuelva tus inconvenientes. | Firstly I like the idea of this app. Rather than scrambling through bunch of different websites to get tickets. You just use this app.

Secondly, I was skeptical about it at first. We went to the edge in Hudson yards. I thought I would have to go back to the ticket counter & get tickets. But it went smoothly. As soon as we went in, the staff was happy to see the QR code and let us in without any questions. I have only used it once. I am actually looking forward to reuse this app. | I bought go-city passes for Barcelona, Paris, and Rome.  In Rome, NONE of the places listed as included (except Big Bus) took our tickets. We never got the chance to try them in Barcelona, but if you are thinking of traveling outside the US, AVOID THIS COMPANY! | Since you buy passes first, then reserve, you cannot get a pass for what you want to do because everything is already booked. | Processed three different orders and each was cancelled, effectively maxing out my card (at least for 1-2 billing cycles) without a deliverable. WTH. | Seems to difficult to figure it out! | Be aware that this pass is not all inclusive as they say. If you see tours from the same company in this pass, even though it says all inclusive they only let you do one of the tours, not multiple. | It‚Äôs a bit confusing on how to add the passes. | The effort to connect the pass to the reservations is unnecessarily complicated and not user friendly. It asks for the code for the passes when you follow the links to make the reservation. It doesn‚Äôt tell you you will need the code nor does it automatically provide the code. It should be pretty simple to make this on a secure link. | Very convenient | A COMPLETE NIGHTMARE! Trying to sync tickets purchased at Tickets At Work is taking over a hour. I purchased 2 different kinds of tickets and Go City doesn‚Äôt recognize all of the tickets. The rep otp was very pleasant and a little hard to understand. Horrible experience. | Frequency of Hop on Bus can be better | When I bought the pass it was supposed to include a lot of things. When I got to Paris none of the things that were supposed to be included were part of my pass. Almost everything said I had to pay more. I would not buy a pass again from this company since they changed what was included right as I got to the city and started going places. | We purchased the family a 3-day pass in Stockholm after having an extremely positive experience with the Copenhagen Card. Unfortunately this pass and the app are NOT as user-friendly as that one. We couldn‚Äôt get on any of the boat tours we wanted because you can‚Äôt sign up in advance without being at their kiosk which doesn‚Äôt help on a short trip. The hop on/off buses were very confusing as there are two different companies that run practically identical looking buses but this one only ran 3 to cover their whole city route on a busy holiday weekend. When asked about it, the customer service was very defensive (to the point of being borderline rude) with little to offer as a solution. They also dropped a few of the attractions between the time I initially looked at it and booked the passes. Given our experience I would have rather booked tickets directly with Stromma and paid for the various museums than deal with the hassle that has been navigating the pass/app. | The lines to use this pass are extremely long.   Hour + long wait‚Ä¶don‚Äôt purchase. | Great app & it‚Äôs super easy to use. Plenty of choices to pick from to see various sites within a city. What‚Äôs the point of the app???

title: App in the Air: Top Travel App
description:
2021 Webby Honoree for Best Use of AR ‚óÜ‚óÜ Editors Choice ‚óÜ‚óÜ Best of 2018 Watch App ‚óÜ‚óÜ Featured in Forbes, Wired, The New York Times, Travel+Leisure and more.


At App in the Air, we believe that travel should be easy and stress-free. Whether you‚Äôre planning a relaxing getaway or flying to an important business meeting, the journey should be as enjoyable as the destination. App in the Air removes the complexities of travel, and instead, streamlines the entire travel experience: from simplifying planning and booking, to providing you with the information you need before, during, and after your trip. App in the Air is your all-in-one travel companion.


Download App in the Air for free to join our global community of 7 million+ avid travelers.


TRAVEL STRESS-FREE
- Set up automatic check-in to claim your preferred airplane seating, even when you‚Äôre busy.
- Get real-time flight notifications for check-in, boarding times, gate changes, delays, etc. (even without WiFi).
- Track your live trip status from your lock screen with Live Activities.
- Subscribe friends & family to SMS trip alerts so they know you‚Äôre flying safe.
- Record your travel history with a 3D map that visualizes your full travel history, and statistics that keep track of which aircraft and airlines you‚Äôve flown.




BOOK WITH EASE
- Use filters like number of stops, times, amenities, alliance programs, pricing and more to search for your ideal flight itinerary. Our smart tools offer predictive pricing‚Äî with machine learning, your search options will evolve over time as you interact with the platform.
- Your search results are optimized based on your loyalty status and fares that will earn a higher points yield (select airlines currently).
- App in the Air has a direct connection with all major US airlines, your favorite low-cost carriers, as well as British Airways, Lufthansa, Eurowings, and more. There are never any hidden fees‚Äî just pure convenience.
- Browse and compare over 2 million hotel properties worldwide sourced from our direct partners including Booking.com, Hotelbeds, and Expedia. Uncover non-public hotel deals exclusively available in the app.




TRAVEL RESPONSIBLY
- For every flight or hotel booking made with App in the Air, we plant a tree on your behalf to support reforestation efforts around the world.
- Offset your flight-related carbon impact. App in the Air automatically calculates the number of CO2 tonnes you should offset to go carbon-neutral.




CONVENIENCE & COMMUNITY
- Connect with other travelers flying to or from the same airports as you with our nearby feature. Compare flight statistics to see who the ultimate frequent flier is.
- Discover helpful airport tips and honest airline reviews sourced directly from our community of frequent fliers.
- Track loyalty points across all your loyalty memberships in one place, including British Airways Executive Club, JetBlue TrueBlue, Lufthansa Miles, IHG Rewards Club, Starwood Preferred Guest, Le Club Accorhotels and more.




FREE INTEGRATIONS:
- Connect your email to automatically import your flights, hotels and car rental info
- Sync your itineraries through TripIt
- Email forward your e-ticket information to myflight@appintheair.com




Have questions? Email us anytime: support@appintheair.com
Terms of Use: https://appintheair.com/terms-of-use
releaseNotes:
Dear friends, our fresh version 8.7.8 is out now and contains some bug fixes and improvements

If you like the update we would be happy to see your review on the AppStore!

Questions / Suggestions? Write to us 24/7 at support@appintheair.com 

Let‚Äôs keep flying!

Sincerely, The App in the Air Crew
reviews:
If you are having an issue with this app, don‚Äôt expect it to be resolved quickly. I have asked them to call me numerous times and I‚Äôm about to lose money because of this company. 

Absolutely ridiculous | Premium options are way to expensive to even remotely consider it. The ads creeping in for travel insurance, eSIMs, etc. are also making this app les useful and easy to use. I do enjoy using this to keep track of my flights past, present, and future but I think it‚Äôs starting to miss the mark for me. | This is the only travel app that has difficulty synchronizing all of my flights. This is also the only one out of the four paid travel apps that continually displays ads. I have asked them to disable them, unless I explicitly consent. I promise to do that. They lied. | Best thing about app in the air is being able to look down on my phone and see a push alert locked on my phone telling me how much time is left on my flight ! | Been using the app for a couple years and bought the lifetime subscription so I‚Äôm stuck with it.
Good features are that that it imports from TripIt. It can split flights between your own and other people. It updated to include live activities feature. Now for the bad - some flights are inaccurate or delayed. The app itself is confusing and has too much unnecessary information such as ‚Äúcheck in‚Äù countdown, ‚Äúboarding‚Äù countdown. The checkin is not even accurate per airline as southwest allows checkin 10 mins before departure but appintheair chooses an arbitrary time. Also lots of advertising to book hotels and other nonsense. If I was starting again I may go for their other competitor flighty | It is all good with the app except the past flights information can‚Äôt be found in all 2023 (including the flight number, departure and arrival). Hope you can fix this. | Best app available for your trip is very Accurate. You can see if there‚Äôs a Delay, if there‚Äôs a delayed of your flight is very accurate the information. | I absolutely love this app and use it to log and track all of my flights, but some features just need a little bit of work. 

Generally a trip with a layover has a single Booking Ref Number and ticket number, so if there's a way to input that without doing it for every single flight, that would speed things up a lot | This app used to be AWESOME, always keeping up with the latest information. But the last few years it‚Äôs not giving accurate or up to date info. Wrong gates, wrong boarding times‚Ä¶ imagine the impact of that on your travel day. I PAY for this app. A subscription. And now I don‚Äôt trust it. So today I am cancelling and this is why. At first I thought it was an anomaly but today I‚Äôm realizing they never got themselves together & inaccurate info is the norm for this app. It‚Äôs too bad.

UPDATE TO RESPONSE: I sent you all of that months ago. I‚Äôm not spending any more time on it. | Been using the app for a few years now and I just love all the new features and improvements to it. 

I don‚Äôt even need to upload anything anymore, it‚Äôs smart enough to pull everything from my Airline Loyalty Apps

Keep up the good work and looking forward to more new features you have in the pipeline | I‚Äôm not sure why I have to watch ads for travel insurance and a summary of my last year‚Äôs travel. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to get that off the opening screen and I‚Äôm a paid user. 

When I‚Äôm traveling I don‚Äôt want to wade through this clutter on my screen | Incredibly useful while flying an traveling. The support team is AMAZING in helping with any issues there may be. Great job guys! | this used to be my favorite travel app- tracking the arriving plane, up to date info before the carriers apps updated but over the last week (right after purchasing a year subscription!) it was useless tracking the flight, the plane that wasn‚Äôt even there and while i was sitting at the airport waiting hours for my delayed plane the app showed me to be in mid flight! i also bought for the apple watch face which i thought was a great idea but it doesn‚Äôt sync at all. next step is to cancel subscription and try to get my $ back since it failed so massively the time i needed it most! | I‚Äôm a flight attendant and I LOVED this all simply for the interface I could put on my watch! Though it stopped working a few weeks ago! I‚Äôve tried uninstalling and reinstalling and updating my software and it‚Äôs still not working. Please, for flight crew everywhere, fix this! | I‚Äôve used this app a lot and am actually glad I have it. It keeps me updated on changes or delays, etc. makes traveling a lot easier when you have the right info. | This app used to work spotless but now when it says that the plane landed ,it is still in the air approaching the airport. Lifetime subscription and whenever deleting the last manually added travel information it says it is synching , you need to quit the app so it stops synching. 1-Your 2023 review does not get deleted and stuck there forever and 2-Do you need help also is stuck on screen. 3-Also found out that it tries to get my other iCloud account email account (although now that it is blocked) . I think when I got this app was to follow planes and not to book hotels and other stuff. Over the years a simple working app is bloated by information we don‚Äôt need.
The Apple Watch app does not work !!! | –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ —á–∞—Å–∞—Ö –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª—Å—è –±–∞–≥ | If you fly american whom i only fly this app doesnt work. Love that i bought a lifetime sub. Now i need a new app and cant even transfer all my stuff over. 

Heres to starting over! | They decided to use a pill-shaped progress bar for tracking flights, and even worse it uses green as the progress indicator.

As a result it looks like a battery indicator and it actually hides your real battery indicator. 

This needs to be seriously reworked. | I‚Äôve loved and used this app for many years as you can see from my review below. However, I am unable to recommend this app until an ongoing bug gets resolved. You can not add people (subscribe) them to receive updates regarding your travel plans. This is a huge feature of the program and I‚Äôve been told it will be fixed  soon. It‚Äôs been at least 18 months. As a Lifetime user, I‚Äôm about ready to cut my losses and try another program if AITA can‚Äôt get this fixed soon. Very disappointing.
________________________

I‚Äôve been using AITA for years and was so impressed that I became a Lifetime paid user. I had a UI suggestion and within 12 hours, I was contacted and problem fixed. I have never had such great customer service from any company. I‚Äôm not a big power user, but I sure appreciate the service I was provided as an occasional flyer. Totally recommend ‚ÄúApp In The Air‚Äù for any of your travel needs! | ÂÅöÂæóÈùûÂ∏∏Â•ΩÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÔºÅÂ¶ÇÊûúËÉΩÂú®‰∏≠ÂõΩÂ¢ÉÂÜÖ‰ΩøÁî®ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊîØÊåÅ‰∏≠ÂõΩÂ¢ÉÂÜÖËà™Áè≠ÁöÑÂêÑÈ°πÊúçÂä°ÔºåÈÇ£Â∞±ÁÆÄÁõ¥Â§™ÂÆåÁæé‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂ∏åÊúõËÉΩËÄÉËôë‰∏Ä‰∏ãËøõÂÖ•‰∏≠ÂõΩÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÔºÅ | Great app for day for day of travel and tracking your stats across airlines! Very cool flex to show off all your trips if you are a frequent flyer. | I want to like this app but it doesn‚Äôt always find my flight number correctly so i just have to add manually. I‚Äôve tried sharing my information to social media and it comes up blank. Flighty seems to be better | I've been genuinely impressed with this app's overall efficiency and user-friendly interface, making it a go-to for my needs. However, I encountered a hiccup when trying to import my flights from the calendar a feature that just doesn't seem to work. Despite reaching out to the support team for assistance, I was disappointed by the lack of help provided. This issue aside, I still highly rate the app for its performance in other areas. | It‚Äôs a must app for all travelers, especially those using IOS, flawless integration between all devices.  Knows about gate changes before the airline employee.  And all for free?
