Also Air France-Flying Blue sync/login doesn‚Äôt work. App has been quite buggy lately. It used to be better in the past. | Good app to keep and track your travel plans and history. 
Excellent Customer Support. An issue with adding the flights to the calendar but corrected with a new update in a timely manner while communicating with the support staff. | Used to be a great APP but recently it‚Äôs getting weird! I‚Äôve been to Japan for more than 10 times, however in my record it shows only 5 visits (the routes on the map are correct though). It says I‚Äôve been to 69 countries in the record but only 64 countries for the stickers‚Ä¶ I chosen the English language, however every time when I tried to export my record as an image, it‚Äôs in different language‚Ä¶ please fix the above issues please, thank you so much. | Tried booking a flight from Chicago to Harrisburg, and the prices I was seeing in app were always 5-10% more than the ones I saw in google flights. Maybe they are pocketing the difference or their data is wrong. Either way, it does not give me confidence to book with them. Also choosing which class I want is not straightforward, with the info not matching the airline website, so it‚Äôs not clear what upgrades I‚Äôm paying for (like is seat selection included? Is ‚Äúpremium‚Äù seat selection included? Etc). | The app idea is great. But the options don‚Äôt work as well. You can‚Äôt link a reward account. It doesn‚Äôt accept any of the codes you‚Äôre given. And a lot of features were available without subscription and now all you can do is see you flight info which you get through any other app anyways. A bit disappointed. | There‚Äôs a few things I really like about app in the air - consistency of information makes traveling a lot easier, a single place with my travel history - and it‚Äôs pretty easy to use.

Once they started making subscriptions a priority - the app‚Äôs now riddled with useless info, for subs and free users alike. Maybe worth it if you travel a lot and are looking for company üëÄ | I‚Äôve been using this app for several years now. Their support team is great and has helped me resolve issues I‚Äôve had. Recently however the app has continued to make more and more features premium only, even though they used to be free. It‚Äôs a shame to the app become less useful with these changes. | I can‚Äôt enter my data for United and it won‚Äôt tell me why not.   I paid for this? | Been using the free version since 2019 and worked well in the beginning.  Once you have used it for awhile and start logging a lot of trips the program gets buggy.  Definitely wouldn‚Äôt buy the program now since the basic free program doesn‚Äôt work. | This app tracks you across other apps and websites using your identifier, asks for your passwords to sensitive websites, and sells all your info to the highest bidder. Or at minimum are storing it ready to sell, as per their privacy policy, to anyone who buys them out. 

For an app that costs so much, it disgusting how much data collection they have. 

Go with Flighty! Less data collection and a much more polished app. | I like the basics of the app. But there are glitches when adding anything to the wallet. | I watching on Flightradar24 the flight JSA232 (6-Oct-2023) circling near to the airport. Yet app in the air announces that the flight has landed. It is not the first time such glitch happened. Quite often the app informs that a flight has departed, yet you can see the airplane is sitting next to a gate | Been forwarding email to just@add.flights many times in the past few days to add my flight to the account. The function doesn‚Äôt work! Reached out to support who promised an agent will reach out to me in 12 hours but I haven‚Äôt seen anyone reaching out.

Overall, this app feels like a beta. Flighty maybe more expensive but it does the job well in terms off flight management.

Cons:
- it doesn‚Äôt  tell you when your gate changes 
- weird language display: when you flight in enroute, it will tell you your flight is landing in approximately how many hours instead
- flight itinerary forwarding via email doesn‚Äôt work ( I tested with Southwest Airlines)
-  Auto check-in mostly doesn‚Äôt work. Mostly because when I set auto check in to my flight it doesn‚Äôt do anything instead it keeps notifying me about check-in. There‚Äôs no way to mark if I‚Äôve checked in for a flight.

Keep raising your price without making your app better is definitely a straight ticket to heaven. | Love it | Not working after update | While the latest update may have fixed 30+ bugs, it also caused a new one. When trying to view an existing trip, the app crashes. | Used to be a great app, now it‚Äôs extremely bloated with half of the stuff not working properly and the other half just being too cumbersome to use. 

On top of that the app has changed its focus to try and get you to book things through the app (probably for commissions), constantly nagging you to book a hotel or this and that with no way to disable it. 

Such a shame. 

Nowadays I‚Äôd recommend Flighty over App in the Air in a heartbeat, Flighty is more focused and streamlined if you fly regularly and aren‚Äôt in need of all the noise about hotels, rental cars, sight seeing, passport, boarding pass, etc. etc. | Very usefull. | I‚Äôve been using this app for a few years now, and it is by far the most useful flight tracking app I have ever used, and I use pretty much all the big ones that are out there. The tech-support is also incredibly responsive and address issues within a day. I‚Äôd highly recommend this app to any frequent business travelers out there, along with a lifetime subscription that is well worth it for the additional features it provides. | I am frequently flyer for my business. I gave this app a try for my last few flights. It was consistently wrong in its timings for boarding, flight tracking, and landing. Even when I reported delays directly in the app, it would show the flight as boarding about to end when we hadn‚Äôt even started yet due to the delay. Shows the flight landing when we‚Äôre still in the air. Come on this is basic stuff that you can pull from any number of sources. 

The UI is clunky, cluttered, and confusing. There‚Äôs too much going on. They need to focus on getting the basics straight and not trying to do everything all at once. | I‚Äôve been using App in The Air for many years and it has been a trusty travel companion. Unfortunately, over the past couple years, the developers have pivoted their business to flight and hotel bookings.

Each time I open the app I am accosted by up-sells and customer-hostile designs to lure me into booking another flight or hotel. But, that‚Äôs not why I originally fell in love with this app ‚Äî it was because it helped me track and plan flights! The developers seem to have lost sight of this, and have all but abandoned making any improvements or design refreshes to the original flight tracking and planning features. It seems, somehow, that those core features have actually gotten worse (and harder to access). In fact, compared to some of the competing flight tracking apps, App in The Air now feels clunky, corporate, and out-of-touch.

PREVIOUS REVIEW (5 stars):
Love having flight paths and information along with boarding times on my watch and my phone. Slightly inconvenient that there's no pull to refresh feature on the iPhone - which means I have to force quit the app and open it again to see changes after adding flights. | I‚Äôve not been traveling enough lately to justify the paid version yet, but it‚Äôs been great to keep documents in one place. I like the maps and stickers and trip data aspect of it. I‚Äôd like to see it take the profile stuff a little further and add a trip log for writing about the trip, and have the option to keep it private or post it to share with other travelers. Over all, it‚Äôs pretty much unrivaled in what all it can do.

Update: I have the pro version now and it‚Äôs pretty comprehensive. Being able to add documents to all the trips and append hotel and car rental information in addition to notes on each trip pretty much hits everything I need. Looking forward to playing around more with it. | Easy and convenient app to make traveling a little more stressful. Good app | In the last year or so, this app has gone from decent to horrible. Their flight database is not regularly updated. When scanning boarding passes or manually entering flight detail, the information added is incorrect. I personally I am on multiple flights each week and the information they have in their database on major carrier‚Äôs flight numbers and routes is incorrect. having provided them with multiple examples of this, the response received is always ‚ÄúThe carrier it failed to update our database for us.‚Äú honestly, what major air carrier, or any carrier for that matter, is going to update a third-party apps database on flight detail? | It‚Äôs a generally well-ish designed app, especially for the user interface, however, there are still many kinks to be smoothed out. It frequently and senselessly groups my random hotels and flights together with no way to splitting them up. For example, why would a hotel in Japan for august be in the same trip as a flight from Chicago to San Francisco in a different month? ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Another big issue is that, it reads flights booked but not cancelled, that‚Äôs still fine but often it can‚Äôt even add flights with a clear confirmation from the same airline. Same airline, same email format, but some flights get recorded and some not. I just don‚Äôt get it. 
So yeah, decent app, but much improvement needed. 
Thanks dev team.

title: Nomad eSIM: Prepaid Data Plan
description:
Travel like a local with Nomad!
Get high speed, flexible, no-contract eSIM data and SMS at unbeatable prices. No more switching out SIM cards - get connected in 5 minutes! Install and activate eSIMs in 165+ countries and 8 regions. Get international eSIM data plans from as low as $1.5 / GB across Europe, North America, Asia and many more. Regional and country-specific plans are also available to suit your travel needs.
Share your Nomad referral code to your friends, you‚Äôll get 300 points (equivalent to $3) for your future purchases for each successful referral. Your friends will also get $3 off for their first purchase.

What is an eSIM?
eSIM stands for embedded SIM and allows you to get connected anywhere, anytime, on (most) flagship devices, without ever having to visit a shop or buy a physical SIM card. As long as your phone is compatible, you‚Äôre good to go.
Check compatible devices here: https://www.getnomad.app/shop/support_device

Nomad major features include:
*eSIM Data plans for 165+ countries and 8 regions.
*SMS packs for US, UK and Canada at this moment.
*Loyalty points, add-on purchases (top-up),  multi-currency payments, multi-languages and data usage monitoring.
*Get recommendations and find inspiration for things to do and eat while on your trip and much more coming up!

Why Nomad: The Easiest Way to Get Connected
Near-local Prices: No contract, no hidden fees, no unexpected roaming charges.
Connect instantly: No more waiting in line, get your eSIM contactlessly within 5 mins. Easy installation via QR code.
Convenient & Flexible: Keep your primary SIM for call & text, no more swapping SIMs at the airport.
Find Travel Inspirations: Select the descriptors of what you are looking for and get recommendations! Pin or save it if you want to shortlist the place, or swipe left to reject it and see more recommendations.

How Nomad Works:
*Buy an eSIM Data Plan: Search for your destination and pick any data pack - from 1 GB to Unlimited data plans
*Install the eSIM: Easy one-click installation or install via QR code. QR code will be sent to your email and Nomad App.
*Activate your plan: Only activate when ready to use, please make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi or have stable data connection.
*Buy a SMS plan: Choose a plan from US, UK or Canada - from 100 texts to 500 texts, and you‚Äôre all set! Anyone can receive and send texts to/from you. Your SMS plan is also good for both local and international texting at the same great rate!

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact us at https://getnomad.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new or send us email through hello@getnomad.app

Visit www.getnomad.app to find out more about Nomad.
releaseNotes:
- new eSIM data plans
- UI update
reviews:
Lots of issues changing countries, not ideal for nomads. 

Support is fine until there‚Äôs a problem they can‚Äôt solve. 

In my case they just disappeared for DAYS and you only get an apology email days later for the long delay. 

It saves time, and is safer, to use a traditional eSIM. I almost did, but my ride app was working fine with airport WiFi.

But imagine being in a taxi in a foreign country where you don‚Äôt know the language and can‚Äôt see where the driver is taking you. 

I‚Äôd contacted support one or two days before my flight to avoid issues like this, explaining that I‚Äôll be in a new country and asking how to ensure the installation goes smoothly.

I also reached out from both the departure airport and the arrival airport. Still, I was left with no connection because the app wasn‚Äôt working properly.

I could send and receive support messages on the app but nothing else worked, it kept freezing up. 

I tried 4 different apps, including the ride app, and all worked perfectly, except Nomad. 

If this issue is resolved it would be a great service. Hopefully tech can figure it out. | We used Nomad eSIM‚Äôs a few times and overall we would recommend their products.
Used it in China on an iPad Mini and it worked like a charme. Installation was easy, great connection and good data speeds.
Recently we used a Nomad provided eSIM in Argentina and it has been rather disappointing. They use Movistar and Personal for cellular service and their connections as well as the speeds have been rather disappointing.
Our regular US cell service with T-Mobile connected to Claro - no compari! So much better availability, much faster and reliable connections.
The China experience was a 5 star, Argentina a 3 star at best. We will still use Nomad in future but they should definitely look for other/better carriers in Argentina. | Instalacion sencilla y relativamente r√°pida | Website works great on mobile son it‚Äôs fine, but I really wish I could stay logged into the app on two devices at once. Also, lately I get an error when I try to add on data, so I have to go to the website. 

But customer service is TOP NOTCH and worth dealing with some bugs. | I used this app in India and it worked great! I did have to use a VPN while in country to reload it, otherwise no issues. | It was not working properly in Bangalore, India but all was ok in Bangkok, Singapore and Korea. | Worked perfectly for my trip to Germany | I am traveling on vacation with my family and did not want to pay the $10 a day from my US cell phone provider. I downloaded the Nomad app. I full capabilities on my phone! | On my trip to Australia I bought the e-sim online; the qr code installed easily but the internet didn't work and I was never able to use it; I tried several contacts with support to ask for a refund and only received automatic responses; I don't recommend it to anyone... buy it at the airport and you won't have any problems. | This e-sim application saved me in India when the local sim was turned off due to a silly, complicated Visa misunderstanding. Although it‚Äôs more expensive than getting a local SIM card, it‚Äôs hassle free and easy if you take your time and follow the setup instructions. All we need nowadays is data, and NOMAD connected me to the network with speed and reliability. Took less than 15 minutes. Thanks! | Total fail in installing the plan I purchased from Nomad. I'm visiting Argentina, downloaded and paid for the plan (iPhone 15 iOS 17) . The *paying for it* is the ONLY part that worked. I have spent three hours of my life trying to use what I bought from Nomad -- but have failed with every restart, reboot, each dive back into iPhone Cellular settings to change settings per conflicting directions on Nomad site and app. Included in Nomad‚Äôs fails are useless instructions, conflicting pop up screens, and ... buried at the end one of of the two ‚ÄúCongratulations on purchasing‚Äù emails from Nomad ... notice that the eSim was actually provided by "eSim Go". That latter fail was enough to send me down a thirty-minute rabbit hole getting rid of ‚ÄúESim Go‚Äù so that I could succeed with Nomad. Conflicting instructions on how to activate, tech support only available after a business day, FAQ article useless. The New York Times should retract their endorsement. Epic fail.

Update 2/6/2024:

Dear Nomad, 

Kindly do not accuse me of making things up in your online reply. Here are subject lines of the TWO emails I received from Nomad after I paid:

1. Welcome to Nomad! Travel like a local with eSIM!
2. Here is how you access your Nomad plan!

Sadly, neither email was helpful in actually making the plan functional. Eventually, a colleague who‚Äôs an IT prefessional and an iPhone iOS expert got me going ‚Ä¶ only after the three hours lost mentioned in my initial review.

(Note that juggling the email screen, and the Nomad screen, the many Nomad popups, and the multiple Settings screens within my iPhone made the nightmare even worse). | The eSIM I bought is very fast and easy to use
Will buy it next time | I did extensive research on many eSIM choices for my travel from the US to Portugal and Malta. I decided to give nomad a shot and am very pleased. I had a tech question and submitted it via the app and they were very responsive and also followed up on my satisfaction. I was out of the US for 15 days and decided to choose the 10 MB package, which was much cheaper than other eSIM providers. On day 13, I have only used 3 MB and I have been on maps the entire time while walking. The service is great with no dead spots. 
I‚Äôd be happy to recommend nomad to all. | I want to use the app but the after sending the code to my email, the keyboard will not appear to type it in. I have done everything to try and force the keyboard open but it won‚Äôt pop up. Waste of time. | Well, I don‚Äôt expect too much from these companies but when I finally needed customer service, they failed miserably. 
A√≠ralo is also pretty bad but I recommend their eSIM app over this one. 
And finally, I recommend a phone with a SIM card slot ‚Ä¶ the new iPhones for the US market don‚Äôt  have them anymore. It‚Äôs the only reason I need buy eSIM in the first place | First time trying it out, I like it so far and will keep using if all continues smoothly. Even got $3 off with a promo code. | The unlimited plan caps you at 2gb a day, but it‚Äôs incredibly hard to find this fine print before you purchase a plan. (Like literally impossible, they have no reference to data capping on their terrible website). Their app is unintuitive, their data plans are OUTRAGEOUSLY overpriced (Lyca mobile is less than half the price for more data in the UK) and in general I‚Äôve had such an unpleasant experience. Not sure who they paid for their good reviews but I‚Äôm really upset | Make sure you use a temp email to sign up for this service. They claim they only send *one* marketing email per month but it‚Äôs one per day. Unsubscribe and they will send you another marketing email the very next day and the day after and so on. | love using nomad, extremely easy to navigate and makes traveling headache-free. ran into some issues and customer service reps were able to get it resolved within 24 hours. will continue to use nomad for my international travels üòä | Great customer service, I had an issue with an eSim purchased for Brazil and they were quick to resolve the issue and issue a refund. I‚Äôve used them traveling abroad in Switzerland, Italy, and England and had a great experience. Only advice is to pay attention to what countries are offered on the eSim (Switzerland likes to be special and require their own) but Nomad is very up front in which Sims work where | I was traveling in Europe and got an eSIM from Nomad.   It worked great until I used up my bucket of data.   When I was hit my original usage limit and rolled over to the new bucket, it said it was used immediately.   I contacted their support department and was told they were looking into it.  Every day for a week, they sent me a message that said they were still looking into it, then they stopped updating me.  I returned home, so I don‚Äôt need it anymore, but I never got any kind of resolution. | I used Nomad to purchase data plans for a trip to China and Hong Kong with mixed experiences. I installed the China esim before my trip and activation was seamless on arrival. My experience with the HK esim was not as positive. Checkout in the app repeatedly returned a generic error message. I was only able to complete the transaction by removing the promo code‚Äîfrustrating because the deal was being promoted in the Nomad app. Once I completed the purchase and activated the esim, I was unable to get connectivity. The troubleshooting steps in the app were not helpful. I contacted support for both issues and they were responsive but unfortunately due to time zones differences I lost a full day‚Äôs use of the plan I paid for because Nomad‚Äôs default network configuration was incorrect. The idea of seamless access to international data plans is great, but be prepared to be anchored to wifi to troubleshoot on arrival abroad. | Awesome travel app for Europe and US. Saved me lots of money and fast connections. | Bought a 45 day plan and so far only getting 4G in Seoul. Literally one of the best markets to have 5G üî• but I‚Äôm poking around like a peasant. iPhone 15 Pro. 3 stars for being average. | I was hesitant to try Nomad on a three week trip given some negative reviews but it worked seamlessly for using different cell providers in 6 countries or regions :  Hong Kong, Macau, Vietnam, Thailand, Singapore, and Taiwan.  At every stop the service worked without a hitch, never needed to reboot or wonder what went wrong. | Stopped working in US and support does not answer | I travel the world a lot and often and this app is one of the best things for me. To be able to easily have date anywhere is fantastic. 
Easy to use and get access to the esims | It works ok but I don‚Äôt receive phone calls for my us phone number or text messages. Add on feature failed and I was left without data. Data randomly stopped working one time and I had to rely on my primary carrier for data to navigate a foreign cut in the pouring rain at night. Use with caution and have back up plans. Not recommended if you use us phone number as you won‚Äôt be able to call or text with foreign data enabled. | Easy to install fast connection,good signal even in crowded areas, glad to use Nomad
( thanks for sale packages ) ü•∞ | All worked smoothly, easy app installation, easy activation, 10 gb for only $12 USA. What more can you ask. I even got 5G speed in cities. | I‚Äôve purchased a APAC 20GB for 45 days . The data shows 5 G but only can run 5Mpbs. you can barely do anything with this internet. | I used in Switzerland and worked really good! | In the midst of a genocide, thousands bought e-sims for people who don‚Äôt have access to telecommunications and internet. Nomad made changes to ensure that these people couldn‚Äôt use their e-sims. Absolutely not reliable and grossly dehumanizing. | Don‚Äôt bother wasting your time with this. The internet speed was so slow it wasn‚Äôt even connected‚Ä¶ literally. It acted fast for the first 30 minutes and then got so slow it couldn‚Äôt even load the plan in the app. I deserve my money back and so does anybody that ever bought this crap | Would rather have paid more for actual 5g speeds from a legit provider | Upon arriving in Barcelona, Spain I started my Nomad connection. No hiccups, just plain access to my text, WhatsApp‚Ä¶ etc.
One little problem created by a conflict between my expired purchase and the new SIM, I contacted the help support and‚Ä¶ the team could not be more professional, dedicated, knowledgeable.
The communication was excellent and prompt.
I recommend NOMAD with the certainty that it will make your life easier. | Used in Australia and New Zealand. For the most part it works fairly well. The app is quite good compared to others and using Apple Pay is nice. The downside is that you will get a Hong Kong IP address, which can be a bit sluggish and cause issues with apps and websites that block Hong Kong. For Example, Citi Bank and TikTok will refuse to work. Even on local WiFi, TikTok will not work unless you turn the eSIM off in your phone settings. | Thanks guys!!
Easy to buy 
Easy to install
And it works!!! | Bought a 45-day plan for Asia 16 countries. Worked well 7 days in Seoul Korea, plus 2 days in Shanghai China. Stoped working after no matter how try. | Muy buena app para viajar, buenos precios, f√°cil para recargar los planes. Abarcan muchos pa√≠ses. | I purchased wrong data plan by mistake. And I contacted customer service in help center. They responded quickly and help me to canceled wrong one. And also teach me to purchased correct one. | My husband and I travel full time worldwide and using the Esim has been a huge money saver. Installation process is easy, even for this retired ladyüòâ When I have run into any issues their support team is quick to respond and walk me through the process. Currently in Japan and Rachel was quick to help me solve an oversight on my part in the simple installation process. Use my referral code if you want to save on your first use TEAC55AJ | You download the app and start using your phone with the number that was given to you. It is that easy. Compared to another app I bought, NOMAD is much friendlier. Highly recommend this without any hesitation. I used this for my Italy trip and had no problem at all. So what are you waiting for? Go get this. Morie A. | The team at Nomad provides excellent customer service. There are times when these type of apps need adjustments or I make mistakes with Settings and they always are willing to help and they're very quick to respond. This is not been my experience with other data apps I highly recommend Nomad. | So grateful to have found this - easy and inexpensive e sim that allows us to stay connected (and not get lost!) when we travel. Have shared with friends and family - | the app and their esim are a complete disaster, travelling around Europe, it eventually worked less than 25% of the time, the rest I payed roaming with my local company, I didn‚Äôt have any option, their customer service is just a Q&A and they definitely have nothing they can do as their product is so poor and completely incompetent. it's literally a waste of your money. It worked in London it didn‚Äôt in Cambridge. It worked in Paris, it didn‚Äôt in Amsterdam, Berlin and the rest. It was so disappointed | Had hopes to use this but after setting up my account, selecting a plan, and going to checkout was notified that my device was not compatible because only unlocked devices are able to use esims. Would have been nice to know before I wasted so much time. | the app WAS great for months until it magically all started sucking up my data and they did not give me full refunds for my issues. i would use my phone completely as normal and not do anything differently and then magically all my data would be used up in a matter of an hour. they said it was snapchat causing it but that‚Äôs a bit confusing since i used the esims for months before encountering this issue (with out changing anything about how i use my phone)s i then switched to another esim provider and have had no issue, so it 100% was an issue w the nomad esims specifically. just be careful with spending your money as they are very stingy with refunds. i only got a few vouchers and a redemption code that didn‚Äôt even work. | My esim card didn't work and they have me asking repetitively for a refund. | A couple times it didn‚Äôt connect with cell towers but for the most part it worked when I was in Italy and Portugal. Recommend if you don‚Äôt need a phone plan abroad.

title: Worldpackers Travel the World
description:
Travel changes people, people change the world. Worldpackers is the safest community to travel and volunteer with. We connect more than 3 million travelers with 20 different kinds of hosts in over 140 countries!

What makes it awesome?

   - Confirm your trips with peace of mind: become part of a community with 9 years of experience and thousands of successful trips
   - Contact thousands of hosts: apply to as many positions as you like with our verified and responsive hosts who are reviewed by our community
   - Rest assured that your trips are backed by WP Safeguard: if anything doesn‚Äôt go as planned, we‚Äôll help you to find a new host or reimburse you for alternative accommodation
   - Count on our support team: 93% of travelers were satisfied with our help in English, Spanish, and Portuguese, available 7 days a week
   - Become a Pack member and get access to incredible discounts from our partners!
   - Earn a little money: when you have 3 or more positive reviews, you can get an exclusive promo code, refer people to WP, and earn $10 USD for each new member who signs up with your code.
   - Get inspired with our Academy and Blog: video lessons and articles by travelers who have overcome the same obstacles you‚Äôre facing and are now living their lives with more freedom, flexibility, and travel

Come join us!
releaseNotes: Hello traveler! In this new version we fixed bugs and made some improvements so that you can plan your trip without breaking a sweat =)
reviews:
So I downloaded this app in hopes of traveling the world helping others in other countries while adventuring, I paid 99$, I got a reply from someone but it wouldn‚Äôt let me reply back to them, the app was slow and glitchy, and I couldn‚Äôt even complete the courses because the site it tried going to to take them wasn‚Äôt a secure site! So I reached out to world packers and told them I wanted a refund and apparently I don‚Äôt qualify for a refund even though the app doesn‚Äôt even work. | It‚Äôs a volunteer opportunity‚Ä¶ I get having to pay a small fee to maintain the app but ‚Ç¨50 per year?? Insane profit-seeking price, and especially since the app doesn‚Äôt even work that well. | Why cant I send a message to people that have volunteered at some place and left a review? | This app is very easy to use and helps the aspiring world traveler to feel comfortable with applying for jobs and new experiences in new places :) | I‚Äôve heard so many great things about Worldpackers and I‚Äôve been trying to apply but their app has been glitching and I‚Äôve been fighting with it for an hour trying to be able to sign up and it just won‚Äôt let me. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed because this is something that I wanted to do for a while. | I love everything about the app and opportunities it brings and the plans are so worth it. The only issue/bug I wish they‚Äôd fix in the app is I have favorited hosts that closed their position and I have no way to unfavorite it and it just takes up room. | If it was life time payment would be better like cough-surfing but still looks interesting to me like a traveler! Thanks | We foreigners spend thousands of dollars to go and meet people, but in return we get treated like cattle, for example putting 7 people in small 2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment. And if you say something you are wrong, yeah right paying to be wrong and to get treated like cattle. | Pay for the subscription and made my profile and literally nothing works. My profile never updates. it‚Äôs not even allowing me to apply to any places. ‚òπÔ∏è | Just updated, still NO tabs work, this is 0 functions app and should get a 0 star review. Very disappointed:( | This app/company is amazing! They do an incredible job of connecting willing and eager travelers with certified organizations and hostels to provide housing and other amenities in exchange for some form of agreed upon work. It is a great way to travel if you‚Äôre not afraid of doing things on the cheaper side along with being in a constant state of meeting and interacting with new and interesting people! | I love to backpack and this app helped me make a bunch of dreams come true and is continuing to do so, if you are a traveler this can be one of the best apps you can ever download | This app is everything that I was looking for and more, my dreams are becoming true thanks to this app. | Something is wrong with this app, it‚Äôs not working, anything I try to do it gives me a ops error message. | The app is very easy to use. Some of the features are a little confusing, but after I contacted with some questions I understand completely why they‚Äôre like that now. Great app and communication with the team. Rebecca helped a ton! | Tres estrelas por enquanto pois eu estou pagando, estou tentando terminar as aulas pra conseguir o meu certificando mas n√£o d√° certo. J√° assisti a mesma aula cinco vezes, e n√£o conta de jeito nenhum! J√° tentei de tudo, assistir no Wi-Fi, nos dados m√≥veis! Nada conta! Ent√£o tr√™s estrelas por enquanto!  Ent√£o todas as vagas estou aplicando sem certificado por erro de voc√™s! Espero uma resposta! | I just downloaded the app and I‚Äôm getting 
Something went wrong :
(Please try again later.
Something went wrong :( Please try again later. | Um aplicativo completo cheio de conte√∫dos e com total seguran√ßa | The app itself is fine but I cannot get notifications to quit, despite them being turned off inside the app as well as in phone settings. And not just actual notifications but also push-ad type stuff for memberships. It‚Äôs frustrating but hopefully just a bug that can get corrected in an update. | I have been volunteering almost an year with you.It is been fantastic and helpful.

I would just be recommending to add one more answer to public comment,from the volunteers,not just one :) 
(I‚Äôve got a untruthful comment from 
A stressed host and could not replay in order to don‚Äôt affect my profile ..) | Worldpackers is unlike any other travel app on the market. The promise is engaging and straightforward‚Äî lend your talents and skills in exchange for an experience in a new community. 

For $49 you get full access to certification courses that can help you learn more about the roles and opportunities you can request in and bolster your profile for maximum engagement with your future host. The user interface is responsive and easy to navigate for first time guests and those with low computer literacy. 

The chat feature is effective and allows you to directly engage with the host of your choice in a safe and secure way. There are many ways you can stand out and showcase your skills and talents, which helps you better align with meaningful opportunities. 

If you are a creative, conscientious and curious traveler I highly recommend this app. | So I‚Äôm planning an upcoming trip to Latin America. Very excited to try out Worldpackers for the first time and psyched by all the things I‚Äôve read about it.

The review is purely for the app itself. When I go to the Academy section, nothing I click on works, even the Continue Watching intro series on ‚ÄúHow to be an outstanding worldpacker‚Äù. I basically have to go to the mobile site to watch.

Everything else works fine but when a whole tab malfunctions it‚Äôs kind of a bummer. I downloaded it yesterday too so I know I have the latest version. | Muito bom | WorldPackers really changed my life. I had the best experiences through them. There‚Äôs a lot of amazing hosts and thanks to the reviews, I know what I‚Äôm getting myself into. I haven‚Äôt had a bad experience and will continue to keep using the service. The App is just great to have instead of constantly logging back in through the browser and it‚Äôs easy to navigate. | The app itself holds all the information but it‚Äôs not very device friendly on my opinion.  It‚Äôs hard to narrow down opinions and then has gotten buggy as well, but other that that it‚Äôs good for the little that it offers and keeping in touch with the other members.

Not good for searching opportunities at all in my opinion | I was really excited to find this program, and so I went ahead and paid the membership fee. After using it for a few hours I noticed a few issues that could be fixed for UI. For example, when you open a position and you read under activities, it gets cut off in the bottom. I also noticed when I was inputting my background info the text would run off to the side and get cut off as well. I may consider just using the website instead but so far it‚Äôs been fine. | Worldpackers collects $50 from travelers by selling a false expectation that people can get free stays in exchange of volunteer ‚Äúwork‚Äù which they pitch in a way that doesn‚Äôt sound like work. We were a host on the platform and the first 5 travelers who came really had no interest whatsoever in working at all. The first traveler wanted to tour the island the second day of work, the second traveler never showed up, the third one ended up upgrading to a paid room once they understood there was volunteer work involved otherwise and the fourth went on vacation after two days of volunteering. Don‚Äôt waste your $50 for the false hope they sell you. If you‚Äôre truly interested in volunteer work, all the NGOs including our our NGO have websites that advertise for volunteer positions. You can Google and you will find them at no cost to you. | I went to browse, it‚Äôs been a over a year since I logged in, and my entire app is blank. I‚Äôm getting a user error | App is easy to navigate | Very useful and easy to play with | I downloaded the app for the first time today. Unfortunately I was not able to signup with Facebook. When I tried to use email signup, I got stuck at giving my birth date. The datePicker somehow shows blank and I was not able to pick my birth date on the picker so I couldn‚Äôt complete the signup process. What‚Äôs good about this app if user can‚Äôt signup and use it? :( | Scam duh | I‚Äôm tired of traveling app like this that tout Verification by payment of a subscription or fees. That‚Äôs only verifying I‚Äôm paying for membership services not because I or anyone else is a safe trustworthy person! Where are the requirements for background checks? Personal references? Of both parties. 
Also, if I can only find one or two opportunities (with no guarantees I‚Äôll get either host spot) and have no plans on making this a yearly lifestyle why should I pay $50 for it?!!! Ridiculous!
App doesn‚Äôt state membership required to apply for position! | Hello, i like your apps idea and what it entails. I would very much be interested in seeking a collaboration as a consultant of NGOs! | N√£o tenho palavras para agradecer a esse aplicativo, estou simplesmente realizando meus sonhos. | Very beneficial to travelers! | I found a few cool sounding opportunities but read the reviews and found 1 star reviews that detailed being manipulated or abused by their host. I‚Äôm confused why those listings are still allowed to be up and now suspicious of the safety of any of the ones on the app since it seems like there is a carelessness towards potential travelers by not removing unsafe situations or screening hosts.

edit: now with the latest updates the app won‚Äôt even load | So, I recently found out that you can become and expert workdpacker and they had programs you could sign up for etc. So I'm logged in and go to check out the programs and it tells me to "log in to apply"

I already am logged in? Anyways, I click the button to log in and it takes me to the log in screen so I login through facebook and it takes me back to the home screen. So I go to click on my profile page where it has the "Become and expert" button and it logs me out of my account. So naturally I log back in and it's just a never ending cycle. It says I'm logged in but when I go to check out the expert programs it says I'm not when I AM. It even logs me out when I go to click on my profile. I would like to become and expert but the app keeps saying I'm not logged in and I haven't logged in when I am c l e a r l y on my account. Fix it, please, it's very frustrating. | It is not letting me upload my profile phone. | Best app ever! Ux is great, there are lots of opportunities in all over the world... i will definitely recommend to my NGO | Amazing App. Shared Economy. Impact. The Best Social Travel Network. Congratulations. | App muito bom. | What about paid if they going to let you work really hard you should get paid as well | It does make you pay 50$ but that‚Äôs nothing in exchange for what it offers you! I bought the full version and now I‚Äôm doing what I love full time ! | This app requires a $50 yearly membership, which I find ridiculous.  HelpX.net does the same job and gives the option of donating $30 for a two-year membership‚Äî a membership for which I was more than happy to pay m when I saw how helpful the site is. | App seems to go smoothly until you try connecting with a host and the app wanta $50 per year for a verification app. Total spoof | The concept of the app is great but it's so limited. I wish I could make my own profile and list all the skills I can offer besides just the languages that I know. The notifications get annoying when people comment the same topic as I did and there's no way to turn them off unless I uninstall the app. | Muito ruim | I like the app, but even after the update, the search feature is still so limited. 

I would love to be able to search keywords so that I can find, for example, work on a vineyard in Argentina as opposed to looking through all 500 Argentina jobs, sifting through housekeeping and front desk work at hostels. Everything else runs fluidly, but the search options need to be optimized. Searching by keyword, sorting by host rating, etc etc. | Exchange your skills for accommodation it's easy and fun with this app, direct and with many options, it's a no brain app to stay installed on your phone.

title: Travel Freely: Points & Miles
description:
Want to travel for free? Now you can with our travel rewards credit card tracker and personalized rewards credit card recommendations. Maximize your free travel earning with hotel points and airline miles.

FEATURES OUR USERS LOVE
Our app is 100% free (no credit card required)
Maximize rewards credit cards
Free guide to maximize airline and hotel points and miles
Personalized rewards credit card recommendations
Automatic 5/24 tracker in the app

Learn how to travel for free with points and miles and use our automated tracker for signup bonus and annual fee deadlines. All for FREE. =) 

Accomplish your travel bucket list! Travel Freely is the amazingly simple app that boosts your travel budget like never before. Forget travel deals. Get free travel. =)

TRAVEL POINTS & MILES
Try our free travel app and our rewards credit card tracker for iOS. Make free travel a part of your life and track your points and miles earned for your favorite airline and hotel. Our CardGenie offers personalized recommendations and shows the best offers available. 

TRAVEL GOALS
Achieve your travel bucket list with our rewards credit card tracker by setting your travel goals. We help you become a free travel planner. Whether it is Italy, Hawaii, or Tahiti, you can get there with points and miles.

CREDIT CARD TRACKER
Are you looking to stay organized and get personalized recommendations with a tracker for your rewards cards that earn points and miles for your favorite airline and hotel? We have the easiest solution. Boost your travel planning. Forget travel discounts and travel deals. Earn max rewards points and miles the easy way to get free travel.

SMART PERSONALIZED RECOMMENDATIONS
Travel Freely comes with our CardGenie, a personalized credit card recommendation tool with the best points and miles rewards bonuses for your situation. Have 100% confidence that you are finding the best rewards cards for you.

WHAT WE OFFER
Brief tutorials on how to maximize your everyday spending with rewards travel credit cards to maximize rewards for the most points and miles.
Use our rewards credit card tracker to organize your travel credit cards
Get specific credit card recommendations for points and miles according to your unique profile and needs
A user-friendly organizing system to set personal travel goals, keep track of your specific cards and points earned, and monitor your credit score. 

BENEFITS
Our users say we have "the best travel app for earning points and miles and using a tracker for rewards credit cards." Rewards credit card tracker and points and miles earning is easy and simple. Travel Freely app can track your rewards credit cards, points and miles earned, and organize your cards for max rewards.

There are many hotel and airline travel deals apps, travel guide apps, points and miles apps, travel planning apps, and travel bucket list apps on the App Store. Among these free travel apps, our simple and organized free travel app for points and miles is one of the most popular card tracker apps for earning free travel and getting to max rewards in no time.

IMPORTANT
Worried about security? Our users love that we do not ask for any sensitive information.

Maximize free travel rewards points and miles with programs: Chase Ultimate Rewards, American Express Membership Rewards, and Capital One Venture Miles. Airline includes Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards, Delta Airlines, United Airlines, Alaska Airlines, and American Airlines. Hotel includes Marriott, Hyatt, IHG, and more.

Have a question or feedback? Email us at support@travelfreely.com.

Download our free travel app on the App Store. Rewards credit card tracker. Maximize your travel planning with hotel points and airline miles. Signup today and start traveling for free!
releaseNotes: A few updates to keep our awesome community of free travelers earning more travel! General housekeeping to keep the app running smooth!  Share your thoughts at letstalk@travelfreely.com!
reviews:
I‚Äôm fairly new to travel rewards, but learning about all the things to consider is intimidating. This app makes it simple and puts all the required knowledge in one place. Without giving up any critical personal data, this app can still deliver personal recommendations, boiling down the complex rules to only the most useful stuff you need to know, right now. It‚Äôs Great, very happy this app exists. | Since downloading this app, I have saved so much time. This app gave me the ability to
know quickly the next best card for me, and ever better lets me know when it‚Äôs time to apply again. I recommend this to anyone looking to level up their traveling. | Thx Zac for your kicka$$ app!  Its so easy keeping track of all of the cards and benefits. Keep up the great work, fellow traveler! | Great app for keeping track of credit cards and points. | I love that I don‚Äôt have to give account numbers but it tracks my cards. Alerts me to when fees will be due if I want to close an account. Suggests the best next card for me | I am new to the points and miles game and need all the help I can get! I didn‚Äôt realize when I signed up for this app how much individualized help I was going to get. I assumed the app was strictly for helping me stay organized which it does! But there‚Äôs also access to a mentor who I am able to ask individual questions to as needed. This is priceless! | This is hands down the best app for tracking cards, annual fees, and rewards. And the card genie feature takes all the guesswork out of the churning game. So glad I found this app. | Zac has personally answered any and all of my questions, super helpful kind! | The Travel Freely app has been great to keep track of my multiple credit cards. Whether you have just 1 credit card or 40, this app will make keeping track of your credit cards a breeze. | Love the app. Very concise & easy to use. Info is easy to see. Lots of info | My favorite feature on this free app is that it organizes your credit cards and sends you an email when you are close to the annual fee time, and it tells your how many cards in the last 24 months you‚Äôve opened (so you don‚Äôt go over the 5/24 Chase rule). Soooo helpful!! | I can‚Äôt thank you enough for developing this app! The organization, the features, ease and use of using the app, and the information is what makes this app so amazing! I frequently refer to this app to make informed decisions of what to do next. Thank you again! | Love this app and everything it does! The only request I have is to be able to add multiple businesses under each person. | Thanks to Zac and travel freely for all of the guidance. Zac is always quick to respond and provide advice. | This app is AWESOME, but sometimes it just won‚Äôt open. Even uninstalling and reinstalling doesn‚Äôt work. | And never able to open it. Even after killing the all and reboot the phone | App is not reliable. Cannot go through the checklist without having to sign in again and again. App is wonky and basically unusable.

Update:
Zac and his team have super responsive to my complaint. They have replicated the issue and have kept me apprised of their progress. I couldn‚Äôt be more impressed with them. Zac even sent me a gift card because my review helped them I.D. the issue. I‚Äôm able to use the website to input my info right now but I‚Äôm confident they will get the app corrected soon. This is the right way to do customer service and I heartily recommend Zac, his team, this app and the Travel Freely site. It‚Äôs a great way to track your cards and the key dates you need to get the most from your cards. Thanks Zac! | This is so useful to track credit cards as well as provide information about timing of getting cards and best travel crafts to get. Have also found the articles to be helpful. Thanks for making this a free app. I definitely find it useful!
-Katrina | The app is a godsend when it comes to keeping track of multiple users with multiple cards. Keeping track of dates (annual fee due, bonus due date) is something spreadsheets can‚Äôt do as well. Highly recommend it for people in the credit card game, both beginners and experts. | I love this app.  I can keep track of points earned, my chase 5/24 status and when cards will drop off my 5/24, and even discover cards I may be interested in next.  Has been monumental in my organization as I have started my travel hacking journey. Doesn‚Äôt ask for personal info on credit cards and I love that! | This app has been very helpful in my process of learning the points and miles hobby! | I still can‚Äôt believe this is a FREE app! Thank you, Zac, and team for compiling your credit card knowledge and honest recommendations for those of us who want to play the miles and points travel game. I hear there‚Äôs a Cash Freely version focused on cards that offer cash back options too! | I love this app! Makes it so easy to keep track of all my cards in one place and when I can apply for my next. It really simplifies what can feel overwhelming at times! | I highly recommend Travel Freely. The app is great and the founder Zac Hood answers emails very quickly. They also have mentors available to help you with the points game. Zack even sent me a free T-shirt. Travel freely treats you like family and I hope you give them a try. | great app to help keep me organized and knowing when my renewal is due. i love the genie recommendations to help me decide which card is best for me | This app has helped me make the most of bonus mile offers to plan some fantastic trips! | I find the Travel Freely app extremely useful. Not only does it help this beginner keep up with cards, the information about cards and the card genie are great!
Zac has responded very quickly when I needed answers. Thanks for your help! | I like how this app recommends what cards you should get and also keep track of when your annual fees will come up and gives a nice review of almost all the cards. I also like how the app creator is available to help and answer questions. | So happy I heard about this app from the Travel Hacking Moms podcast that Zack was on. I‚Äôm so used to keeping excel spreadsheets for everything but this app is so simple to use that I don‚Äôt have to do that! You have access to everything you need to keep track of your cards, annual fees and I really appreciate the available resources right from the app! Highly recommend, especially if you are new to this! | When I first learned about using points and miles for traveling, I was completely overwhelmed. There are so many cards that offer so many different promotions and it‚Äôs really hard to keep everything straight. Especially if you are a two or more person household. This app makes tracking my progress and what cards I have and what cards I should consider easy. I would be lost without this app!! | I‚Äôm still in the process of learning all about traveling on points and this app is awesome at tracking all of your cards, when your next annual fee is due, what cards both you and P2 have and other suggest cards.  So far I‚Äôm loving this app and highly recommend | This is a game changer for keeping track of my rewards cards and going above and beyond with a simple way for me to look up the perks of each card or even make recommendations about which card to get next. | Now that I am in the points and miles game , I was a little overwhelmed by all my new credit cards and spending categories

This app organized everything and it was right on my phone. Now I know what points I have and what CC to use | I‚Äôm a beginner at using credit card points and this app is very helpful at keeping me on track with next steps.  Thankful for the guidance! | This is the best app to use to keep track of what cards you open, when you hit the minimum spend, when you earn a bonus, etc. I also love the card genie feature which lays out the best credit card deals! | Just getting into all this points stuff but am loving the app & solid recs on how to get started & keep long track of your cards. | A clean and handy way of keeping up with your travel credit cards! The app also give you insight into special offers you might otherwise not be aware of. They also dont ask for personal information. | This is a great app. Keeps all my info organized and makes it easy to see what fees are coming up. No glitches so far, and best of all, no annoying pop up ads. | Great app for compiling all your info in one place. So much great info here to help you with points, credit cards and travel. A great resource! | Super easy to follow and track everything. Love everything about it so far. | This app was created by a former teacher.  Awesome. Very excited to save money and travel the world | Honestly this app has helped me so much. They give the best signup links, help keep you organized and focused on the goal (traveling freely) and great card recommendations as well! | I am so grateful to the creator of this app. It is a must have to keep track of your credit cards and the points system. I appreciate the tips and tricks that it provides along with the email reminders‚Ä¶priceless. Thank you, thank you! | I‚Äôm new to the game but love the info and organization from the app.  I emailed a question and response was fast and helpful. | Great app that‚Äôs simple to use and helpful in so many ways!! | Love how easy this app is to track all of mine and my credit cards for both me and my partner | I love how it shows all your cards and tracks important dates for you! | Great app. Organizes personal and business credit cards with the information needed. Not bombarded with advertisements. I had a question regarding eligibility and Zak got back to me with the advice I needed   I do make a point of using the app to apply for cards to support them. | Just discovered Travel Freely a couple of months ago. This app was created so thoughtfully to help beginners in the award travel and credit card bonus space. The step-by-step guidance couple with the video tutorials from Zac are very intuitive and effective. Thanks! | Totally free and so helpful! Their blog has a ton of amazing information.

title: City Rail Map - Travel Offline
description:
The ultimate offline guide for New York, Paris, London, Tokyo, Sydney and many more cities around the world!

"Fantastic rail maps. Each update brings new cities or extra functionality!"

"Maps integration is great; you can quickly see the stations closest to your location, what lines they service, and how to get there. "

"Brilliant all-round the world travel aid for trekkers"

"The only metro app you will need"

"Love Urban Rail Map apps! As an airline pilot who travels the world, your apps help a lot in getting around cities using metro/subway. Love how it works well with Apple Watch. "

Imagina se eu estou numa cidade que n√£o conhe√ßo? S√≥ vai me meter em furada essa porcaria. Desinstalando em 3, 2, 1... | We are going take an urban | Streamlined and simple to use
Well done | What I despise is the way this app was ‚Äúpromoted‚Äù via a free ‚ÄúTokyo Rail‚Äù app which didn‚Äôt do anything but consumed data and redirect to this new for-pay app.

Better be honest upfront. | Wanted me to walk half mile instead of taking train right out in front of me | Not very user friendly, had to use to apps to get where I was going. Gonna keep trying again, until make final assessment. | Would consider buying if it had bus maps too. Doesn‚Äôt have my home town, Dallas metro (DART), a metro area with numerous lines and airport access.

Near totally useless for the country with  the most cities with subways...  China.   

Google maps and Apple Maps have this info for, wait for it, free.

Why or who would use this app? | Confusing and does not accurately represent your location or directions in Milan. | Until yesterday this app was great. It now has intrusive ads on the screen even if you already ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù (i.e. ‚Äúpaid in some way for‚Äù) that city. One star. | Apple and Google Maps do a much better job with transit, are easier to use and are free. 

With City Rail Map:
There is no attempt to show the next train as there are no schedules.
There are no addresses for train stations, though there is a small map which does not indicate your location. 
There is no way to purchase tickets. 
It costs $4.99 to unlock one city. The above are free. 

I do not understand the rating this app gets. Apple and Google Maps are free, apps from the transit companies are free and far more functional (schedules, ticketing). | And then still wouldn‚Äôt work. | This app used to have important maps for free. Now they‚Äôre charging you for every map you need/want except one. I‚Äôm a traveler around Japan and the world and find it very useful but not anymore. Then this app is only free for 3 days.  The app will not allow you to do anything, says support is ending soon.  Money wasted on this. | After using for a few days, the app locked itself up. 

Interface is terrible to navigate. Resource intensive app. Slowed my phone. | Very helpful to decide if I should travel by transit or taxi. | Confusing. No start option or Go option. No en rout help.
