And it lasts one full year and it‚Äôs easy to top it up. 

So, yes I recommend getting a global eSIM

title: Moxie - Word Traveler
description:
Play your cards right to transform words and score ‚Äì just don‚Äôt twaddle! 

If you like making word patterns, strategizing through word puzzles, or beating fun, tricky levels, then you will love Moxie Word Traveler! 

Each level gives you a solitaire-style deck of letter cards to place on the board, creating chains of words. But don‚Äôt break the chain ‚Äì that is called a ‚Äútwaddle‚Äù and it will lock a letter! 

Moxie Word Traveler is perfect for young and old, whether you find word games easy or hard. You can use the words you know to string letters together and beat each level. If you‚Äôre stuck, you can ask the bellhop to help you make a word. 

If you have a big vocabulary, you will still find a challenge in Moxie Word Traveler. Just place letters on the board to spell the highest-scoring words and beat our hand-crafted puzzles. 

Like Scrabble and Words With Friends, you add one letter at a time to the words already on the board, turning them into new words. Like anagram puzzles, word jumbles, and word searches, you use word patterns to find the best spot for each letter. 

You can play Moxie Word Traveler anytime, even if you just have a few minutes. Or you can beat many levels at once ‚Äì it‚Äôs up to you!

Download Moxie Word Traveler today and begin your journey through the original word transformation game, the one that‚Äôs easy to learn and challenging to master!
releaseNotes:
New dictionary: in this update, we have moved to the internationally recognized Collins Scrabble Family Dictionary ‚Äì¬†including definitions, so you can learn more about words you don't know!


Two new chapters: first, feel the nostalgia of a road trip through 50 levels on America's historic Route 66; then dive into the 50 mysterious puzzles of our Loch Ness chapter ‚Äì might you see a certain aquatic cryptid?

One more thing: now you can choose to get a bonus daily reward by watching a short video!
reviews:
Very additive. It starts off simple, but gets more challenging. My only complaint is that I wish it used the standard Scrabble dictionary. There are many words that are acceptable in Scrabble, but not acceptable in Moxie ‚Äî and vice cersa. | I really enjoy this game but one aspect, the word tips,  are useless.
It  only suggests words with the lowest score! Why have word tips that facilitate a lower score? It‚Äôs no advantage at all. Just do away with it. | I absolutely love this game‚Ä¶to the point, I‚Äôve beaten ALL of the available levels. I‚Äôve traveled to all of the currently available countries and I‚Äôve beaten all of the archived daily challenge months. 

I don‚Äôt know what to do with my life anymore‚Ä¶there‚Äôs a void I will somehow need to fill with something marginally acceptable as Moxie. | Love it | Really loved this game until it made me choose Word Tips. Don‚Äôt like being given hints! | I love this game because it truly makes you think and strategize as you place the letters. I enjoy both the daily challenge and the regular levels. I do wish there was one more goal on the daily challenge between 60 and a perfect 4 stars every day, usually about 120. It goes 20, 40, 60, 120. It would be nice to have one more goal, maybe 90? That said, it has become one of my favorite daily games. | Its nearly impossible to accrue points without purchasing them, which I will not do.  Don‚Äôt waste your time on this game. | Love it! I play many word games, and I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect with Moxie, but it‚Äôs smart and intriguing! There have been levels when I despaired of ever finishing, but I learn with every try. One huge quibble: I really hate the new Twaddle sound effect! Icky! Please change it! I like the rest of the sound effects, so I‚Äôd rather not have to play in silence, but that awful ‚Äúwah wah‚Äù is just insulting. Please change it! That said, I‚Äôll play on in silence if I have to, ‚Äòcause I love this game! | Have used many words that are valid dictionary words and game does not accept them. Why? What dictionary do you as creator follow? Consider myself to have excellent vocabulary & have used words you ‚Äútwaddle‚Äù.  Not quite fair & many times will cause loss of game. Explanation please! | Loved the game until I reached approximately level 148, where the rules changed and instructions were unclear.  The game offers no way to go back and review instructions.  In addition, rewards are relatively tiny compared to the effort invested.  The game is very quick to issue lengthy time-outs, but hard work is not rewarded. | I love how challenging this game is! And no ads!!! Thank you for not charging users to escape ads. | I stumbled across this game 3 days ago and absolutely love it! The levels can get challenging but I like that it‚Äôs not impossible to beat (I‚Äôm level 189 right now). I only wish there was a way to submit words to include in the game‚Äôs dictionary, because some real English words get ‚Äútwaddled‚Äù. | This is a great game. No ads. New challenges keep coming. Simple and pleasing graphics. It‚Äôs fun to morph new words. Some levels require multiple tries, but aren‚Äôt frustrating, just challenging. | This game is challenging and fun. It really exercises your brain not only with vocabulary, but also with strategic thinking and a little math. I play it way too often, but I love it. | Lots of fun! Keep up the great work! üëç | Let me play past your goal. It is difficult to stay interested when the game is over in a few plays! | I am definitely enjoying using this app, but it‚Äôs frustrating when a valid word, like ‚ÄúR OO‚Äú is considered a twaddle. However, overall, it‚Äôs a fun game, and I appreciate the fact that I don‚Äôt have to spend any money to play it. | I have played all of the Blue Ox games and enjoyed them all so far. This particular game is half baked. There‚Äôs just not much here. Not sure how this has over 4 stars. The game functions in such a way that you will just end up creating the same few words over and over again or will resort to just swapping out vowels. There is no real incentive to come up with unique words and that‚Äôs where this game misses. It gets really repetitive and boring pretty quickly. Also ‚Äúras‚Äù is considered a word but not ‚Äúfart‚Äù or ‚Äúfarted‚Äù? Come on! The word bank is very odd and excludes many common words which results in a lot of unnecessary twaddles. Also there is no way to see the game‚Äôs road map, meaning you can‚Äôt see how many locations there are to travel to and you can‚Äôt look back at where you‚Äôve been which makes the leveling up seem arbitrary and doesn‚Äôt feel rewarding. This game feels unfinished and was clearly just pumped out to make a quick buck. Not what I have come to expect from Blue Ox. Bummer. Skip this one. | After finding Moxie several months ago, I found it to be so enjoyable. But with the newest update, it has definitely lost its appeal. Having to complete 1500 points every day of the month to attain the monthly bonus seems stingy.  I‚Äôve found myself losing interest in playing Moxie at all. | Until the last update, this game was so much fun. The recent update ruined it. It used to have some easier challenges and some tricker! Now, I can‚Äôt complete any without using all my comps to complete. Now it‚Äôs just frustrating. Sorry you changed it! | Overall, a great game, but several common words in standard dictionaries get twaddled. The most recent one is ‚Äúade.‚Äù This (and several others) actually is (are) in the dictionary. If we know what dictionary you are using, we can avoid unnecessary twaddles. 
Overall though, lots of fun! | Just deleted this game after having enjoyed it for several months. The latest update(s) have made it impossible to achieve anything, if much at all. For example, what is the reasoning behind making the daily challenge even more difficult? Way to make what used to be a fun game super discouraging. | Thank you for this | A smart and fun game, no popup ads, and each round is short enough and with enough variables to make the game constantly challenging‚Äîespecially the higher up you go. This is my go-to waiting room time-passer now. Thanks! | I‚Äôve tried every possible angle for level 886. It gives almost all lower count tiles and having to get to required points, even with bonuses, is seemingly impossible. | I am deleting this game now. 
   Your latest update has ruined a fine game by making it feel cheap and boring. | Keeps getting better! I like the latest change that allows you to replay the daily puzzle until you get the maximum number of keys. (Some days take a lot of tries!) I‚Äôm on level 606 and still love the game. | Love Blue Ox games and this one is another hit. The writers are incredibly creative that sometimes I literally laugh out loud. Moxie is a winner!

 After much frustration they finally included the rules of the game.  That helped but they don‚Äôt allow the most common words and I can‚Äôt figure out why. Maybe they want you to buy more coins but you are dinged for playing everyday words. Of course you don‚Äôt know until you‚Äôve played it and then you forget they don‚Äôt accept that word four games later when you play it again and are re-shocked that you got dinged !!!  I play so many words game and this is the only game that doesn‚Äôt use dictionary.com or word lookup pro. 

I read other reviews and see I‚Äôm not alone in being disappointed that they‚Äôve run out of levels.  I‚Äôve played all the games and asked the developer through email support to let me keep my points and bonuses and restart my game so I could replay from the start but never heard back from them.  So like other Moxie players,  I too am anxiously waiting for more levels. 

This is the first app review I‚Äôve ever posted and have spent more on this game ($) than any other game. Hopefully they will work out the kinks because it‚Äôs an incredible game! üòÉ | This game is all the good things that others have expressed, but it also has drawbacks. For one, there are few ‚Äòrewards‚Äô of coins or power tools along the way, just lots of ‚Äúopportunities‚Äù to purchase same. All other games I play provide a small daily reward for checking-in, and bonus rewards during game play. Some levels are highly challenging (a good thing) but highly frustrating without power tools or coins to buy them (not a good thing). There also seems to be some stinginess when one runs out of lives, which take ¬Ω hour to regenerate. I‚Äôve used up all 5 lives, then closed out the game only to open it hours later and see that all 5 lives are still expired. As soon as I open the game, the first life is just beginning to regenerate. I‚Äôve seen several times when I‚Äôm on Life #5 and it tells me I‚Äôm 26 minutes before the next life is available. Several minutes later when I‚Äôve still not conquered that level, the clock resets back to 30 minutes until the next life is available.  I have also been awarded 4 power tools upon reaching a new ‚Äòdestination‚Äô only to have them all disappear after using just one. Also, the ‚ÄúUndo‚Äù tool is not available when one is at the end of the 5th life. Glitches or greediness? Either way, makes the game less pleasurable. | Fun and very addictive game!

Previously, I wrote the review below that I‚Äôm leaving up just in case someone else had the same problem I did.  Thank you to the administrators for clearly explaining what the problem was.  I had just jumped in and played for points, thinking I knew how to play.  I never had gone to ‚Äúthe book‚Äù to read the instructions before.  I just completed Level 199 which I had tried to best at least 2 dozen times (maybe 3).  The game is even more fun now.  Thank you also for responding in such a timely manner!  Great game, and good people at the helm!  üòä

****
What I wrote previously‚Ä¶

‚ÄúHowever, there is a glitch. There is a ‚Äúgoal‚Äù amount posted at the top left. Reaching that amount MAY cause the system to recognize you successfully reaching the goal‚Ä¶or NOT. Most of the time, while it will acknowledge ‚Äúgoal reached‚Äù on the top left, it does not end the round. It will just keep on counting until you run out of tiles, THEN tell you you FAILED to reach goal! On a 700 goal, I just did over 2200 and it still told me I failed! I wish y‚Äôall would fix this.‚Äù | This game makes me think and I like that! | Love this game, best of all‚Ä¶‚Ä¶*****NO ADS*****üòÄüôÉüòÄüôÉüôèüòÄüôèüôÉüôèüòÄ‚ù§Ô∏è | From the Monkey Wrench creators, this new word fame, Moxie Word Traveler is just as intriguing and addictive as Monkey Wrench!  It‚Äôs a well developed and fun game!  Keep the good work up y‚Äôall! | I would rate the game itself as a 5, but it remains a 4 because:
** The font is way too small**.  It is very difficult to read the score or game requirements (number of letters, for example). | I love Blue Ox games and I love this one, but as someone else noted, after the basic tutorial, there is no help to remember what the perks you earn do for you.

Also, way too sensitive on iPad. In trying to use my index finger to place a letter on the puzzle, the base of my thumb touched the iPad resulting in a Twaddle and I was never able to make a word on that line again. I am sure there probably is a way to undo a move, but as mentioned above, I did not know what feature would fix this.

I played the original Moxie also and was surprised when this version allowed you to use words more than once. Like someone else, I kind of miss the themes, but realize that you have already done that. I honestly think this game could be even better with easy help reminders of what you can do with the various features. Having to leave your game to go back to a tutorial, till you memorize the symbols, is just too time consuming and makes me play less out of frustration.

Nevertheless, I like the game immensely but am hoping for updates to help. | You can‚Äôt delete the guy that tells you how to play the game. I know how to play the game. I don‚Äôt need to need the lessons at level six!!! | I‚Äôve only played for a day or so, but this game‚Äîlike everything I have from Blue Ox‚Äîis a fun and engaging word game! | I like this game but the scoring doesn‚Äôt make sense to me.  Right away my red hearts said ‚Äúfull‚Äù but I have no idea what that does or what it means.  I like to do the daily puzzle but you can‚Äôt earn any points that way.  I do several other puzzles each day but never earn any points.  How many puzzles do you need to do to earn points? Could you explain the scoring somewhere? | How is zen not a valid word? | This game is excellent-  I enjoy playing it | ‚ÄòFart‚Äô is not a twaddle! (Who thought those two words would ever be in the same sentence??) | This game is both fun and challenging | I love this game! Im on level 283
Play this game, you will not be disappointed!! | Best word game in a while, something new and clever. I‚Äôm addicted! | This game sounded really interesting when I read the description. I tried to download it, and it was successful. When I tried to open and play the game, my phone would freeze due to using a screen reader. I hope you all can provide easy access for those of us who are blind and visually impaired, in order for us to enjoy what this app has to offer as well. thanks in advance for trying to improve accessibility for all! | I love this game! I‚Äôm just surprised that some words aren‚Äôt accepted like: zen, Dane, June. I thought these were fairly common words. | I love the game. However when you‚Äôre trying to reverse a selection (going back or redo), which is allowed and costs a few points, the game locks up and you lose your points and progress. Very frustrating. | This is the perfect game. For all of you word game people, this game is challenging and fun. Please add more levels. | Game froze again when I tried to change move I made.  I was on level   503 and was forced to delete app and lost all my progress.  Help | Best new word game I‚Äôve seen in awhile! Fun and challenging!!

title: Hotels Booking - Travel deals
description:
In our application you can book a hotel, buy air tickets and other travel services online.

Find millions of flights, hotels, houses - all in one app. 

Book your trip safely and securely with just a couple of taps and swipes:

- Use filters to easily find the perfect location for your placement.

- Receive online booking confirmation

- Manage your bookings by making changes anytime, anywhere.

- Get the most out of your trip by discovering local attractions.

- Choose and book an individual flight with any airline in the world.

- Play the exciting game in the space where you need to avoid asteroids and comets.

Also, our travel book will not let you get bored! You can guess riddles by capitals (capitals are entered letter by letter) and you can also read useful articles that are provided in the slider.

title: Mapstr, save & share places
description:
Mapstr lets you keep track of all your favorite places around the world, tag them, and share them with who you want!
To remember your best spots (restaurants, bars, museums...), your friends recommendations, and to plan your next trip, download Mapstr and build the map of YOUR world!

‚Ä¢ Works everywhere in the world
‚Ä¢ Create you own places, even in the middle of the sea ;)
‚Ä¢ Add tags, notes, and pictures to your places
‚Ä¢ Discover your friends' best spots
‚Ä¢ Access the places opening hours, pictures, website, phone number, etc.
‚Ä¢ Compare route options by Uber, Lift, Citymapper, Waze, etc.
‚Ä¢ FOR FREE, NO ADS!

At Mapstr, we believe your places are precious and private: for each of them, you can choose if you want to share it with your friends or not.

Get rid of all the restaurant business cards, notebooks, articles extracts... and join the hundreds of thousands of users of Mapstr, the best rated map-meets-notes app, loved by GQ, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Elle, etc. 

‚Ä¢ Directly import all your Foursquare or Swarm checkins, your contacts, or your old excel files...
‚Ä¢ Steal your friends favorite places
‚Ä¢ 3D Touch & Apple Watch
‚Ä¢ And a lot more to come :)

We've built Mapstr to enhance you every day life, so please, tell us how you use it!
-> hello@mapstr.com

And if you like it and want to support us, please, give us a 5 stars review, you'll make us more than happy :)

For those who wants to read our terms of use, here they are: https://mapstr.com/terms.html, and our privacy policy is: https://mapstr.com/privacy.html
releaseNotes: Small fixes and updates in the onboarding section :)
reviews:
Terrible user experience. Couldn‚Äôt navigate back to the Home Screen after signing up. Lost me 2 minutes  ‚úåüèª | It asks me what city I am in, so I type it, London, and it doesn‚Äôt work (no results). So I type several cities in America, still nothing. I type in Dubai, Tokyo, Rome, Paris and more and still ‚Äúno results.‚Äù It‚Äôs sad because this looks like a good app | At first I thought I was imagining things, but I tested it with a few specific restaurants and monitored whether or not they disappeared over time. A bunch of my restaurants are gone from my map, which defeats the entire purpose of the app. switching to Beli. | Love the app but even after several exchanges with developer still cannot edit locations that do not have an address which are the majority of my 1k locations (waterfalls, trailheads, kayaking river access points) ‚Ä¶ | I found the interface very confusing when I tried to skip entering my phone number. After a bad review and multiple developer follow ups, I finally found how to skip it. I still think it should be more clear. Update: My one star review is because of the interface regarding entering my phone number which I found to be confusing. The screen has a blue circle with a white phone at the top and a big empty field which says ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your phone number?‚Äù and way down at the bottom of the screen it says ‚ÄúShow My Friends‚Äù This interface is bad because in the previous screens I was asked for my preferences, and I was asked to share my contacts, which I declined. These screens had a very helpful ‚ÄúLater‚Äù button which gave me a clear way to skip. But this last screen that asks for phone number did NOT have a ‚ÄúLater‚Äù button. So it switched interface paradigms near the end of the process after setting up my expectation that I could skip with a ‚ÄúLater‚Äù button. So I assumed if I tapped ‚ÄúShow My Friends‚Äù it would tell me the phone number field was required. I am the user. I found it confusing. I am entitled to give a one star review for an app that I found hard to use. If I could give it ZERO stars, I would. I might reconsider if they make the screen more clear and add a ‚ÄúLater‚Äù or a ‚ÄúSkip‚Äù button to that phone number screen. Otherwise, my review is one star and I gave it because in my opinion the interface of the app was confusing to me when I wanted to skip entering my phone number. Also, since I did not share my contacts or enter my phone number, it makes no sense to have a button labeled ‚ÄúShow My Friends.‚Äù My intention was to use this app as a way to bookmark cool places I have been. Nothing to do with friends. Which again, think about how confusing the interface is: I did not share contacts or enter a number, and now the only button I was given was ‚ÄúShow My Friends.‚Äù It makes no sense. Especially as a new user, I am expecting a ‚ÄúShow the Map‚Äù button or something like that. As I said: I found this interface to be confusing. | I absolutely love the idea of this app, I‚Äôve had it for awhile but every time I try to open it I have to ‚Äúreconnect‚Äù it to my Facebook account and 75% of the time it just won‚Äôt reconnect and I can‚Äôt pull up my maps. 

So many bugs that need to be fixed that have been occurring over the last 5+ months. | Perfect way to organize all my favorite spots without cluttering my driving maps.  Can‚Äôt recommend enough!! | I absolutely love mapstr whenever I have a day off I love to go explore news places right in my own backyard! Or if I am coincidentally in the area of a place I‚Äôve marked I always try to make a stop, thanks to alerts that you can set. I could rave Al day about the customization of this app truly but, I did come here to say 2 things, one, that I wish there was a function where you could pin something and it would recommend you others like it or things others near that location have pinned! I think it would be a great addition because sometimes place really are hidden. Two maybe having a toggle function where you could see reviews for the place you‚Äôve pinned if you wanted. I love having my own personal map but sometimes for places I haven‚Äôt been a review would be helpful. I understand that‚Äôs what the internet is for but having it streamlined into one place is just a little more convenient. I love this app with all my heart and regardless of what I think I will continue to use it forever :) | The app logs me off and tries to get me to establish a new account every time I open it.  No one has the time for that, no matter how useful a new app may be and even if they love the concept‚Ä¶ | I just want to say that you guys did a great job with this app. For several years now I‚Äôve been keeping everything in my notes, but this is clearly superior. I have one improvement that can be made since I saw another app do it. I like the tags feature, but you can make it so that we can modify the order that they are shown in on our list? I think it would be nice for aesthetic purposes. Because that way my tags can all be in the same order down the list without me having to delete and re add them in order every time. | I‚Äôve been using Mapster for a number of years. I travel a lot for business and I would store restaurants and other places for reference for when I‚Äôm on a trip and seek a restaurant or tourist spot I have saved in the area. 
It is probably user error but as the app has evolved, my ability to find saved items where I‚Äôm at, or search for places I‚Äôve stored, but don‚Äôt recall exactly what they are called, has become an exercise in frustration for me. I really liked it as a reference library of my places, I‚Äôm not really interested in the social media aspects. | I just wish the app was more offline/offgrid friendly. Or at least have the ability to toggle a button to turn on/save for offline use. The app will not open if I have no signal/wifi. And sometimes I can get it to work offline if I stick my phone in airplane mode (50-50 chance). Other than that, it‚Äôs a pretty swell app. | I have used this app on several trips. The ability to map sites of interest is such an excellent idea and tool for travel. However, you cannot retain or add maps. If there is an ability to add additional maps then I could not determine how. | When I first found Mapstr about three years ago I recommended it to many of my friends out of my excitement with what it was then and hopes for its future. Unfortunately, the app seems to me to have been on a fairly constant trajectory towards feature bloat that has made the core experience harder to use and appears to have degraded performance.

I wish the tremendous effort that it must have taken to convert this app to a social network would have been instead directed to making improvements to the UX of the core experience of adding and viewing places. Specifically the biggest issue to me is content density: there is lots of whitespace in the UI, there is much less information displayed about a place than in other map apps (so that I have never been able to meaningfully rely on Mapstr for this info), and many touch targets are too small by modern standards. Also important to me is performance, especially on app launch, which is unfortunately much slower than other apps (and often banners appear which further distract from accessing the map quickly).

On the social side, I would have been quite happy with the simple ability to share lists/categories/map via link, and no concept of ‚Äúfriends‚Äù whatsoever.

HOWEVER, I have a lot of respect for the developer, which seems to be a really small team, possibly just one engineer. Persevering with a project like this, where your competition is all massive companies, for as long as you have (without selling out!) is impressive and commendable. I still think Mapstr has potential if the development focus can be returned to the core experience. | Mapstr is by far my favorite utility app. I love recommending others use it because if they don‚Äôt have mapstr then they aren‚Äôt able to remember all of the cool places they hear about to visit, especially in our home city, Chicago. | The app is nice itself, just wish they didn‚Äôt sell your data. Now I get random creepy emails from the CEO of this app asking me to verify my email address over and over again and junk emails addressed to my burner handle (which I created especially for this app), so I know it was them who sold it to the scammers. So annoying. | This app is a great for keeping track of all the places you want to save. However, I would really like the option to use it on an iPad. Developers: can you please update this app so it can fit on a larger full screen display? | This app used to be fantastic but the recent changes to it have been fairly detrimental 
Firstly when I open the app I don‚Äôt want/care about a news page, everyone is clearly only using it for the map section 
Secondly the performance has taken a hit recently, I used to be able to speed through different saved places but now there is a second lag when selecting/deselecting places
The centre arrow button‚Ä¶ hitting that should always just centre on your location, move the ‚Äòcentre elsewhere‚Äô button somewhere separate 
Basically I used to love this app and recommend to everyone because it was so smooth and easy to use and had such a clean interface, it‚Äôs not the same anymore | Good luck mapstr | I‚Äôve been using this app for years as my way to keep track of bars and restaurants and I think it‚Äôs the best way to do it. But it keeps getting more and more bloated every time they add ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù that distract from its main purpose which is a map app. I don‚Äôt need prompts, recommendations, and lists. I just want to have a directory of my favorite places. | No matter what I do it won‚Äôt let me get past the sign up or sign in process, it asks me if I want to follow a list of people and then it starts to load the map and then crashes. I have not been able to use the app. | Hey guys, love the app but if I can make a suggestion, it would be so useful to see the names of the places we added on the map without having to click on the tiles which can be slow and inefficient. Would be great to be able to eyeball all the names.

Thank you!
Matthieu | Used this app throughout Spain and France and it was great to keep track of all the placed we wanted to go and learn from others what to check out.  Hate using it on the phone though.  When will the tablet format come out? | Just got the app and the first place I added shows the correct address on the listing, but shows up in the wrong place (a few miles away) in the map. I added a couple more that seemed to be accurate. But by the 7th one, the opposite error, is shows up in the right place on the map, but has the wrong address (completely different state this time) and even name of the restaurant wrong.

Seems like a cool idea for an app, but I haven‚Äôt even added 10 things yet and I‚Äôve already run into two big errors with their database. I reported the errors to Mapstr through their app, so we‚Äôll see if they get fixed, but that many problems right off the bat doesn‚Äôt bode well. | I have iPhone 12 Pro Max with latest iOS and am currently in Singapore. I love this app a lot and it‚Äôs exactly what I want except the gps doesn‚Äôt work. The precise location doesn‚Äôt work either and doesn‚Äôt notify me when I‚Äôm nearby even though I enabled it. The support couldn‚Äôt resolve this. Such a pity because this would be great in singapore and Asia but I can‚Äôt recommend it if the main feature doesn‚Äôt work here. The company should really look into it. | I‚Äôve tried several apps that were meant to serve the same purpose, but each was always lacking something. THIS ONE IS PERFECT! They cover all the bases. | Great interface, but EXTREMELY buggy. Expect the app to freeze about twice for every one time that it works properly. | Another app that forces you to create an account so they can get your email or facebook info, as well as your travel wants and history. All I want to do is make sense of the hundreds of places Ive been. Simple. An account should be a choice. | Crashes when opening the app | Love the app! Please please just add the following 
1. Ability to rate each location 
2. Ability to add dollar signs of cost | Please explain why my account that I have used for years, was erased. | I love this app! I‚Äôve been using it to keep track of places I want to visit all over the world. It‚Äôs awesome. Super easy to use and fully functional. Great dev as well. I have two suggestions: a colorblind mode and a tip option. The tags get very difficult to read if you‚Äôre colorblind. And, for people that really don‚Äôt need premium features, it‚Äôs be nice to be able to support the development with a tip now and again. | Use it all the time for recommendations, places I see and want to try, and places I want to remember in NYC | The map and places tracking tool is way better than any other app out there now for simplicity and ease of use. 
EXCEPT. That no matter what I do, restart, update software, delete, redownload, it always slows down all apps on my phone. Not just this app, its not only warping time in its own world, but it slows down everything on my entire phone until I close it several times.
These bugs are going to ruin it for me! So disappointed, I even emailed about it and never got a response. | I‚Äôm so glad my boyfriend introduced me to this app. I love being able to look back at places I‚Äôve all visited, notes about what we ate, and to see other places nearby. | I love this app - I especially like the way it allows me to track locations that I want to remember to visit the next time I am traveling to a location, or even to keep track of cool spots and highly-rated restaurants in my hometown, with tags and/or ‚Äúyou are nearby alerts‚Äù to help me find them when I finally get around to checking them out. Highly recommend! | I have been searching for years of a way to keep track of the fabulous food scene of Chicago.  Mapstr is the best app to do that. Tagging by neighborhood, cuisine, chef, great rooftop etc etc has been super helpful for me to be able to easily pull up great options that meet my criteria. Many friends and family contact me because they know I‚Äôll have great recommendations on where they should go because of mapstr. I love how there‚Äôs now more room for a restaurant description. More detail has helped so much! I also love that I can include links to online articles about the place so I can easily find more info. Super excited to continue to add more locations to my mapstr!! | I know there is a social aspect to this app, but I really use it to keep track of places I want to go in cities I‚Äôm exploring. For that, it‚Äôs perfect. The only thing I don‚Äôt like is that you have to tag everything, but that‚Äôs not a big deal because it forced me to be a little more organized in my locations. | Mapstr is the second app I use the most, right after Instagram. I use it in my hometown or when I travel, I store my own spots or look for new ones to discover. Couldn‚Äôt recommend it more!! | It‚Äôs just perfect. A clean, simple way to track and remember places I want to visit or have already been and loved. | I love Mapstr, it is so useful in my everyday life! Very easy to use and so practical! Being able to add tags to every places you save on the app makes it super customizable and practical. I no longer have 100 notes on my phone with restaurants ideas my friends talked to me about or that I saw a month ago in a magazine: all these places are on my Mapstr, ready to be tried! Also, being able to take inspos on my friend‚Äôs maps is what makes it much better than any other app! 
Really love it! Recommend ++ | Great app to save all your best places in one place. I‚Äôve been using it daily for more than one year and the app works very well! | My only regret is not having this app 10 years to keep and share my favorites addresses | I love Mapstr and have been using it for a few years now. Maps are important to me when I travel and having this app suits my way of organizing the things I read or hear about that I want to visit. It‚Äôs also handy in LA where I live, since there are cool things to see and eat in many neighborhoods that may be off my beaten path. In Paris last fall I was able to easily see places that I had been plugging in rather than going thru a folder full of old clippings and then not knowing where they were, my previous method of saving good ideas. Very useful! | I love this app, it‚Äôs how I keep track of all the restaurants I have visited and want to try. I highly recommend it! | Love this app! Using it all the time! How to get reviews from people you trust instead of strangers... | For anyone serious about exploring (read: people who are both curious and organized), you can do no better than Mapstr. | I love Mapstr. I love to travel and use a map to help me plan and navigate trips. Mapstr allows me to save the places that I‚Äôve been and reference them as I go. You can share your map with friends or keep it to yourself as you travel over time. Very simple to use and easy to understand. | When I find a new venue to visit or get a recommendation, Mapstr is the way I keep track. My favorite is going to a neighborhood I‚Äôm not typically in and looking at the spots I‚Äôve marked. Easiest way to keep the adventures flowing. | This app was recommended to me by a French friend a few years ago. I love it!

1. It‚Äôs great for those times you walk past restaurants and think I‚Äôd like to try that but then you always forget. This way you can just save straight into the app

2. You can save places you‚Äôve been so you don‚Äôt forget them. Especially for holiday destinations 

3. You can share with friends who ask you for recommendations and the tagging system helps localize their preferences

It works perfectly

title: Weather Radar - NOAA + Channel
description:
Weather Radar is the most accurate, reliable weather tracker and forecast app, allowing you to stay ahead of weather patterns in your area or anywhere across the nation. Whether you use weather radar for your daily planning or for safety measures, we have got you covered with reliable weather data packed in an accessible design. 

Rated the leading weather app in over 30 countries and with over 3.6M downloads worldwide to prove it, Weather Radar offers live updates 24/7 and exceptional weather forecasting.

WHAT MAKES IT THE #1 WEATHER FORECASTING APP?
‚Ä¢ Detailed hourly forecasts over the next 10 days
‚Ä¢ Live rain and snow doppler radars
‚Ä¢ Future precipitation forecasts 
‚Ä¢ Animated wind map with a 12 day wind forecast
‚Ä¢ Weather warnings on maps & extreme weather alerts (storms, floods and tides) (US only)
‚Ä¢ Hurricane tracker
‚Ä¢ Lightning tracker
‚Ä¢ Weather Charts with info across temperatures, precipitation, wind, pressure and UV index
‚Ä¢ AQI (US and Canada)
‚Ä¢ Home screen widget (iPhone only)
‚Ä¢ Lock screen widgets with time to upcoming rain, rain gauge and more
‚Ä¢ Watch extension


UNIQUE INTERFACE
Weather Radar combines all available weather information into an intuitive and accessible interface, making it easy to use for all ages.


DETAILED WEATHER INFO
Weather Radar provides you with accurate charts concerning the development of the most important key weather-related values in any location you wish and lets you zoom in to see how they could impact you. This gives you a clear view of temperature, precipitation, wind, pressure, and UV. These charts can run anywhere from hourly to 10 days in the future and can be combined to meet your needs. 


HURRICANE WARNINGS AND INFO
Stay on top of any hurricane‚Äôs development, its predicted path, directional changes, wind speed, wind quadrants and much more with visual images.


SUPPORTED COUNTRIES AND REGIONS


NORTH AMERICA: United States*, Canada, Mexico
EUROPE: France, United Kingdom, Germany, Spain, Portugal, Netherlands, Switzerland, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Denmark
ASIA-PACIFIC: Mainland China, Japan, Hong Kong, Korea, Taiwan & Australia


*Frequent severe weather conditions coverage in Florida, Texas, Alabama, Oklahoma, Kansas, Louisiana, Arkansas, Georgia, Mississippi, North and South Carolina


WHY SUBSCRIBE TO PREMIUM?
We want to bring essential weather information to you for free. Are you in need of more in-depth data and a wider range of features? Say no more:


With a Premium Membership you'll get access to:
‚Ä¢ Lightning tracker
‚Ä¢ Wind map
‚Ä¢ Extended rain and snow doppler radar
‚Ä¢ Get Weather Reports for multiple locations
‚Ä¢ Ad-free Experience


Subscriptions automatically renew each month 24-hours before the end of the current period and your iTunes account will be charged unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period. You can turn off auto-renew any time from within the app. Any unused portion of a free trial will be forfeited if you purchase a subscription.




If you have any suggestions or are unable to find the answers to any of your questions our support team is ready and happy to help. Simply email support@impalastudios.com


Terms & Conditions: https://impalastudios.com/terms Privacy Policy: https://impalastudios.com/privacy
releaseNotes:
In this latest update you'll find: 
‚Ä¢ minor bug fixes and performance improvements.
Thanks for your support, and enjoying using our app!

Love the app? Then don't forget to rate us!
reviews:
Awesome app reasonable price | Unless you pay, you won‚Äôt see much if anything at all. | Was forced to change/update my NOAA weather app because the one I had been using stopped updating on the radar selection, was stuck on March 3rd-basically useless. I am not going to pay for any weather service, but in the process to get noaa updated it repeatedly takes me to the ‚Äúyou have to pay for radar‚Äù page. I‚Äôm finally past that but now I‚Äôm not able to get any radar to come up‚Ä¶but the ‚Äúpay for it‚Äù option continues to cover the bottom of my screen üò° The updated version is full of useless/unnecessary charts and graphs, just give the forecast each day: high-low, wind & percentages for precipitation. Should‚Äôve stayed with what I had, expect to delete noaa and try something else. | I don‚Äôt live in or near Harrisburg Junction! | The app no longer displays radar on my device. I also hate the forecast  they added to the bottom of the display. Why take something that works and mess with it? | I turned off notifications, but still received them. I was also receiving multiple notifications for the same exact alerts. So annoying. | I hav e had this as go to for many years, now with ‚Äòupdates‚Äô all I get is crash after 2-4 seconds.  Deleted it. | At 84 years of age I have lots of experience with weather forecasting. I trust my own judgement and with the help of your radar I don‚Äôt even have to go outside to do it. 
As a child, my father and I would go outside and watch the sky and judge if we needed to go to the storm cellar or back in the house. A couple of time it was a quick trip!
Kansas is known for its unpredictable weather. Cliches like: ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt like the weather, just wait a few minutes, it will change.‚Äù And my favorite, which is always right, ‚Äúit is going to be light today and dark tonight.‚Äù | ‚Ä¶me to this App. Not always as accurate as Dark Skies was, but the best one going.  Sometimes it‚Äôs gotten a little wonky‚Äîlike Silver Spring MD for example.

 But in comparison to other weather apps, this is my current gold standard. Would be nice if they crowd sourced weather‚Ä¶thought like that might have helped with accuracy of predicting weather and timing. | Good | This is an interesting app with great info, but it can't even locate me correctly?  It reports me in Junction Texas when I am in San Angelo.  These are NOT very close locations.  

Keep trying guys ... | I know people need to get paid but seriously! How many adds do I need? | Just subscribed today! End of February! | Warnings and forecasts and my location cover the radar on the map. Not very high resolution. Pretty but not that useful. There are better apps. | The advertisement for this app says free, UNTIL, you download it and you‚Äôre informed that it is ‚Äú free ‚Äú for three days, then you have to choose a subscription service. | Very impactful! | I've tried using this, and it expects payment. It's not that user-friendly, and keeps giving me forecast of other areas that I've already left.

Whatever happened to where apps and automatically sits where you are now?

This is obviously not one of them. | Used to be great! Over the past year or so tho, the new developers decided to revamp the look, now it's totally broken. Have to go thru a ritualistic open and close the app two times just to see the temperature.
And the layout is horrible! | I wrote a ChatGPT called Motorycle Mapper Pro and I use this to back it up, turn by turn directions without tolls and highways! Good Job | I really like this weather app so far very accurate has everything I need. The one thing I have problems with is the widget every morning it is blank takes a while for it to warm up and start working. | Thank you love it. | The two small towns I frequent and want to know the forecast for do not populate. They are large enough to populate on all other weather apps.
This is very disappointing. | I just wanted to thank everyone for the support I get in getting through this winter with the accurate information and the fact that you guys are always spot on. I hope you all have a great 2024üëçüåè | This app wants $600 a year to look at the weather? | Nice app but there doesn‚Äôt seem to be any way to unsubscribe so be prepared to pay for it for the rest of your life | Porn ads | The actual radar of this ‚ÄúWeather Radar‚Äù app is completely meaningless. They now only provide 120 minutes of historical data and ZERO time of future radar.  I have several weather apps, all free, this one is no longer of any value so I am deleting it. | Outstanding.I can keep up with the weather in all my important places! | This app sends out tons of notifications for storms that aren‚Äôt even happening. The weather predictions are not even close to accurate. I got 7 notifications, one per hour, for a so called blizzard that isn‚Äôt predicted on any other weather platform. It is not even snowing. Do not recommend. | Radar only goes about 1 hour ahead.  Useless. | Gracias | Worst radar app I have ever used , it will be raining on me and this app shows nothing in my area . Don‚Äôt waist your money and time. | The number one in weather forecast.. | First off- this app does not recognize my city. No matter how I try it calls Cedar Rapids ‚ÄúEast Rapids‚Äù. Not a big deal but indicative and annoying. The hourly forecast is rarely useful. Especially when the weather is dynamic. I guess it does give me weather alerts, but my radio can do that. Just waiting for my subscription to run out. | Too much upselling. How many times do I have to say NO! | Always give the correct news of weather!!!! | Obnoxious selling of prenup | I like the game but I keep lagging and keep getting kicked out. It might be me because my tablet it old. Overall I think it is a great game. | I've downloaded every weather app, this one is most accurate and fav | This app is un accurate, not real time weather another words you‚Äôre gonna get wet if you look at there is rain coming | This is a really good weather app and has nice info | Force you to weekly subscription unless you cancel.  Not easy to cancel.  If I‚Äôd known, no way I would have purchased. | Widgets no longer work üòü | I miss the old weather app Dark Sky. One of the things I loved about Dark Sky was that it was able to give you a view of the radar over multiple days.

The current Apple , weather map only gives 12 hours and not multiple days. To me this is a major failing. | I wish that you could see more of the weather on the radar because I love weather and want to see it without paying for stuff. | Enjoy looking to see where and when we may get some rain. | Charts not synchronized. Text and data overlap on the screen; they‚Äôre almost unrecognizable. | Living in a constant zone of changes, much of daily life is dictated by our weather. I use this app daily & have for years . | Ok | So many ads and attempts to get a premium version that you can‚Äôt even see the program! A storm in the Caribbean is NOT showing!!! Greedy developers!

title: VoiceMap Audio Tours
description:
Experience the magic of GPS audio walks, cycles, drives and even boat rides with VoiceMap tours in over 350 destinations worldwide. They‚Äôre like podcasts that move with you, to tell stories about what you‚Äôre seeing right now.

VoiceMap‚Äôs tours are produced by insightful local storytellers, including journalists, filmmakers, novelists, podcasters, and tour guides. Sir Ian McKellen has even created a tour. It's around London's West End, where he‚Äôs performed for over 50 years. 

Features: 

 ‚Ä¢ Explore at your own pace. Start and stop tours whenever you like, then use the resume option to pick up exactly where you left off. 
 ‚Ä¢ With GPS autoplay, you can focus on your surroundings, not the screen. Tap on Start, and let VoiceMap guide you.
 ‚Ä¢ VoiceMap works offline. After you download a tour, the audio will be available offline along with an offline map.
 ‚Ä¢ If you do go off in the wrong direction, VoiceMap plays an audio alert, and you can follow the map on your screen to the next location.
 ‚Ä¢ Listen to tours as many times as you like both in the destination and in virtual tour mode at home. 
 ‚Ä¢ With over 1,200 free and paid tours, VoiceMap offers huge variety

Reviews and Testimonials:

‚ÄúHigh-quality self-guided walking tours...Narrated by local experts, they provide insight into corners of the city sometimes overlooked by regular guided tours.‚Äù
Lonely Planet

‚ÄúWe may be biased, but could there be anything more helpful than having a journalist in your pocket when touring a new city? How about a historian, a novelist or just a really passionate local? VoiceMap culls city-specific stories from them all and fits them neatly into walking tours.‚Äù
New York Times

‚ÄúMy wife and I really enjoyed exploring Bruges at our own pace with this audio tour, and there were some memorable stories that the narrator shared. Also, the app worked great in relation to the location-based services. We easily followed the map and the audio was triggered in the appropriate spots. In comparison to the packs of people wandering the city with tour guides, this was a much better fit for us.‚Äù
Viator review, Rick A

‚ÄúBrilliant. Can go at your own pace, good information and took us to places we would never have found ourselves.‚Äù
Tripadvisor review, Ravin D

‚ÄúIt was enjoyable to be under no time pressure to freely roam the city of Pisa as we so pleased. Wandering from attraction to attraction. The app is clever, concise and easy to use! Would do again - especially with another person or solo traveler.‚Äù
GetYourGuide review, Grace L

‚ÄúGreat quality information - interesting and entertaining. The time flew by. And no waffle! This is far better than any other guided tour we found - they are much more expensive and far less informative. And you can do this tour any time, any day, at your own pace, and even do it twice!‚Äù
Tripadvisor review, Carcassonne 's Medieval Walls: A Self-Guided Tour

‚ÄúGreat value for money, interesting and very clear and easy to follow! I learnt lots about London I didn't already know and I have lived here over 30 years.‚Äù
London‚Äôs Alternative History Tour, Carmella V.

‚ÄúI loved the tour, bought all of the New Orleans ones you had and have already recommended it to two people. I will without a doubt continue to use the app.‚Äù
Faith & Courage: Metairie Cemetery Stories, Jeremy L

‚ÄúLoved this! Real eye opener for me as a new resident of Singapore who thought this only an island of foodies and engineers. LOL! Please produce more soon!‚Äù
Artoholic Singapore, Craig DeLarge

** Just so you know, GPS runs in the background while you're on a tour. This decreases battery life and it's best to start a tour with your device fully charged.
releaseNotes: Bug fixes and performance improvements
reviews:
Shereen and this tour are terrific! We saw places and learned so much more than had we explored on our own. She also delivers her stories in a fun, friendly, connected way. 

VoiceMap is a great way to do self managed inexpensive tours. We continue to enjoy it. | This was fantastic.  I t was my first time using this service, but it will not be the last! | I am a big Context Travel fan. But this tour was one of the most unique things I have done with context yet. It took me to areas of Tokyo. I didn‚Äôt know alongside some of the most famous places., Excitement, intensity, and com altogether I thoroughly recommend this to anyone who has an afternoon or morning in Tokyo. Thank you very much. | My first trip to London. So I knew nothing. But I‚Äôm guessing the info shared may be enjoyable for anyone. I adored this experience. I‚Äôm a solo traveler and having Ian McKellen guide me with his humor etc. was fun. I laughed out loud a few times.  I will be recommending to my friends. Great walk through London Theater district. And free on VoiceMap. (He has a stop at a pub along the way.) | Exactly what I was looking for. I frequent Geneva but never had the chance to explore it or learn much about its history. This was a great introduction with a great narrator. The app is well designed‚Äîit allows you to put down the phone, stop whenever you would like, and continue the tour seamlessly. Great idea! | So nice to walk and never have to look at your phone.   It knows where you are and talks when it‚Äôs supposed to when you arrive at each spot. Terrific! | Wonderful and interesting walking tour. Just the right length for the heat! | The tour of Old San Juan, Puerto Rico was most delightful and informative. The concept of having students of a with-grade class guide us around the city was very creative and was expertly produced. I will recommend this tour to others visiting San Juan. Thank you for a fantastic and joyful tour. | Excellent. Just enough detail, clearly presented and informative | Traveling through Europe, we are loving this. Great tours and directions. We had looked for similar audio tours a couple years back while traveling in New Orleans and had no luck. This is EXACTLY what we‚Äôd wanted then and briefly considered designing our own app to fill the void. You‚Äôve done the job well! | This was a great tour. John, the Australian guide, was interesting, informative, and funny. The pace was good with just the right amount of history and commentary. I took this tour at my own pace over three days, stopping at all the places that I wanted to see inside. It was a perfect tour of Valencia. I will definitely look for his other tours when I go to different cities. Two thumbs up! | This self-guided tour is an excellent way to see & hear for yourself and at your own pace the history of York. It‚Äôs a magnificent place, well worth the tour and the small fee for the tour. | Loved this app and made my trip that much more informative | Great self guided audio tour with accompanying GPS | What a well-organized and pleasant app for taking a nice, leisurely walking tour. I used my tour to walk around Inverness. My initial doubts were swiftly assuaged as soon as the walk began. The tour guide is very amiable and knowledgeable. The maps are easy to follow. You can pause or linger at a site of interest as long as you like and then pick up the tour where you left off. I learned a lot about the beautiful city of Inverness. I highly recommend this app! | Excellently done and great stops along the way | Let me to start off by saying that functionality wise, this is a very exciting app.  The audio synced to location works well and it‚Äôs an exciting way to explore a city on your own if you don‚Äôt wish to do an organized group walking tour.  The tours I took through this app in Granada, Spain completely enhanced my trip to the city taking me to places I wouldn‚Äôt go on my own and giving me a ton of great information in the history of the city.  That said, I found that the tours for other cities I used the app in (Seville and Madrid) were much less successful.  This app runs on free lance content and it‚Äôs missing a lot of basic walking tours for popular tourist cities, and some of the tours it does offer for those cities are too niche to be appealing for most users.  Hopefully this will change in the future if the app continues to attract creators but right now it‚Äôs missing some key content. | lots of interesting information, fun stops. Well done. | I‚Äôve used voice map for several tours now. I have found them all interesting and different than the ‚Äútour guide‚Äù tours you would otherwise receive. The GPS enabled feature is awesome!

Only drawback is that they are still building out their inventory of tours. So, there may not be a tour in the location you want. | Just what we had hoped.  Well worth the money! You won‚Äôt regret taking this tour. 

Huntsville, Alabama | I was not sure what to see, but did not want to go a group pace. I really enjoyed the tour and the guidance worked perfect. | Outstanding technology blended with expert knowledge of the location at Kilkenny Ireland.  Nice job! | One of the best I‚Äôve ever had and I loved doing it at my own pace. | I used this app a few years ago in Greece to do an amazing tour in Chania but have used it many times since. So fun to hear about a town from a local‚Äôs perspective and learn about the area, buildings & history! | The description starts and stops at the right times automatically. The guide is informative and interesting. | Great information! Appreciated that we could walk at our own pace. Also allowing us to stop
along the way. | Nicely done. The GPS worked well. The information was well presented. Mixture of modern and historical information included with the architectural details. | I liked the tour and the tour guide but my audio kept skipping so I had to read the script. The App was hard to navigate. | I don't fully understand how one doesn't hear of this area in Madrid. M3 from the Gran Via area to the start and M5 at the end of the tour back to the Gran Via area. Fantastic walking tour of an unadvertised local treasure. Google the Madrid Rio Project then take this tour! | Fabulous overview of history and town and architecture. We loved it! Highly recommend this for learning about this historic town and seeing a myriad of places. Narration was fabulous. Thank you! | I highly recommend this app for city tours to use alone or with friends! | Taking a tour with a family of 6 can be cost-prohibitive, so we discovered VoiceMap looking for a less expensive way to visit Charleston, SC and better appreciate the history and significance. We found this app to be exactly what we needed. We found the historical and architectural background to be helpful and very interesting, and we loved going through alleys and less-toured areas. The map gave us confidence that we were headed the right way, and the audio cues were very helpful. | The best app I‚Äôve used for walking tours which makes it easier to leave your phone in your pocket.the content for the Cork tour was also great. | Surprisingly cool app for self guided audio tours. (FWIW j find the UI a little idiosyncratic.) | Amazing once you get it working. We downloaded what must have been a preview of a tour, and took us several minutes after it stopped working to realize we needed to DELETE the sample in downloads after purchasing, THEN redownload from purchases to have access to the full tour. If your tour stops working and just chimes at you when you try to hear things, try this solution. | Very glitchy | Great walk and info
Clear voice | Would like to be able to connect two sets of AirPods Pros, like I can with the iPhone‚Äôs Podcasts app. | Fantastic 

Just what we wanted | As someone who loves solo travel, this app delivers amazing content from its creators. So many good tours on here!! The one thing the app is lacking is the ability to ‚Äúsave‚Äù or create a wishlist of tours you are interested in purchasing. I often browse the tours and then just have to write down the ones I‚Äôm interested in potentially buying. | The content of the tour was 5+ stars. Unfortunately, the audio on the app kept skipping a few seconds frequently, so I probably only heard a quarter of the tour; very frustrating. I tried everything to fix, including deleting and re-installing the app.
I‚Äôm using an iPhoneX with the latest update. Don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs the problem. | I worked perfectly and we were able to follow along very clearly to the directions.  Highly recommended! | Came up from Columbus to explore Toledo and loved this guided tour!  The history of the oWE is very interesting and seeing the old mansions was a treat.  Highly recommended! | I hardly ever, if I ever write a review about an app, but I downloaded this one this morning upon arriving in Verona, Italy, and I had such an amazing day learning about the town, its history, its most famous landmarks, in such an easy to follow way while guided by a native Veronese. The app uses your location and is very precise. I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough.
Yes, you will have to pay to download individual guides for each city but trust me, if you are visiting a city and are interested in actually learning about it, a few bucks is totally worth it. | GPS not syncing 100% | Precise, easy to follow directions and a really fun,fact-filled narrative. It took us about 2 hours to do, but we paused several times to duck into wine stores, look around the farmers‚Äô market, see the inside of Notre Dame de Dijon, etc. We decided to start our three-day stay in Dijon with this tour and we‚Äôre glad we did! Dave, Lausanne | We used the tours from this app in several European cities - Amsterdam, Bruges, Paris and they all were entertaining and informative. 
This format of tour is very convenient - you do it at your pace, always hear the guide and can rewind if needed. | Excellent tour - highly recommend!!!! | Terrible/glitchy app skips the stop instead of playing it when you click to play a stop‚Ä¶ also doesn‚Äôt have directional arrows to show you which direction to go, which is especially tough at the start when the beginning/ending paths are parallel (-_-) it‚Äôs about 11,000 steps with slippery cobble stone steps to traverse and climb- bring water and an umbrella! | We love the step by step but at your own pace! Super informative‚Äô

title: Hot Deals: Book Cheap Flights
description:
Bonus! 15 Best Travel Tips

The best money-saving tip! Departure on a ***, Tuesday or Saturday. 

What are the secrets to booking cheap flights? The real secret to booking cheap flights is geographic pricing. 

Download it now to learn more.

777 airlines worldwide send us last-minute flight deals. Find, compare, and book cheap flights faster than ever before ‚Äì all from one beautiful app. Download the best flight search and booking app now!

„Ç∑ CHEAPEST, QUICKEST & BEST

Need to find cheap flights on the go? Save money and time with our fast & user-friendly app. Search and compare 777 airlines all over the world from wherever you are to find the perfect flights at the lowest fares.

„Ç∑ BEST FLIGHT SEARCH & BOOKING APP

We have won numerous awards as best flight comparison app and are recommended by the fine people at CNN, the New York Times, Mashable, TIME and the Daily Telegraph. With only one tap, you can see which ticket is the cheapest, quickest or best deal. All you have to do is choose and you are ready to travel the world!

„Ç∑ WE DON‚ÄôT CHARGE ANY FEES

We search across all airlines, major travel sites and 100 low-cost carriers worldwide, find the best flight tickets and direct you for free to the companies that sell them. It‚Äôs free! We are an indie app and dedicated to price transparency for all travelers.

„Ç∑ 100% SECURE BOOKING

‚Äì Beautiful and easy to use ‚Äì finding flights doesn‚Äôt have to be tricky and dull

Download the best flight search and booking app now! It's fast, user-friendly & free

title: Travel Channel
description:
Catch up with your favorite Travel Channel shows anytime, anywhere with the all-new Travel Channel GO app - and now get access to up to 14 additional networks including TLC, ID, Discovery, Science Channel and more - all in one app. It‚Äôs FREE with your pay TV subscription. 

Link your pay TV provider (cable, satellite, telco, live TV streaming service) to access Travel Channel favorites like Ghost Adventures, The Dead Files, Paranormal Caught on Camera, Mountain Monsters, Kindred Spirits, Portals to Hell and many more - plus top shows from other networks including Strange Evidence (Science Channel), Expedition Unknown (Discovery), Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives (Food Network), Home Town (HGTV), Evil Lives Here (ID) and more. New episodes are available the same day as they premiere on TV. 

With Travel Channel GO You Can:
‚Ä¢ Stream Travel Channel and more networks LIVE anytime, anywhere on all your favorite devices
‚Ä¢ Find shows to watch with the live schedule guide
‚Ä¢ Access thousands of episodes on demand - from current hits to classic favorites
‚Ä¢ See new episodes of shows on the app the same day and time they premiere on TV
‚Ä¢ Binge your favorite Travel Channel series and specials including Ghost Adventures, The Dead Files, Paranormal Caught on Camera, Mountain Monsters, Kindred Spirits, Portals to Hell - and many more! 
‚Ä¢ Get unlimited access to everything the Discovery family of networks has to offer - free with your pay TV subscription.

Features:
‚Ä¢ Stream live TV when you link your pay TV provider
‚Ä¢ Watch select episodes and entire seasons of your favorite shows from up to 15 networks!
‚Ä¢ Browse by genre - from Natural History, Science and Tech to Food, Home and more - to find your favorite shows and discover new ones
‚Ä¢ Continue watching episodes where you left off across all of your devices
‚Ä¢ Save shows and episodes to watch later with My List
‚Ä¢ Compatible with tvOS and Chromecast
‚Ä¢ Closed-captioning support

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Available in the U.S. only
‚Ä¢ Wi-Fi connection recommended
‚Ä¢ iOS 12 or higher 

Need help? Visit gohelp.discovery.com.

Visitor Agreement: https://corporate.discovery.com/visitor-agreement/

Privacy Notice: https://corporate.discovery.com/privacy-policy

California Privacy Notice: https://corporate.discovery.com/privacy-policy/#cappi

California Do Not Sell My Personal Info: https://corporate.discovery.com/california_dns

We may work with third-party advertising companies and other partners that help us deliver tailored advertisements to you. To opt out of behavioral tracking on mobile devices, you may use the DAA AppChoices Tool, available at http://www.aboutads.info/appchoices.
releaseNotes:
‚Ä¢ Now streaming content from up to 14 networks from the Discovery family, including TLC, ID, Discovery, Science Channel  and more
‚Ä¢ Bug fixes and performance enhancements

Love the app? Let us know!
Have a question? Visit us at Goapphelp.discovery.com
