The UI is kinda complicated, but the app comes packed with features and is pretty customizable. If anything the interface just takes some getting used to, but is decent to navigate once you‚Äôve used it for awhile. 

The vector maps are clean, and you can tweak the way they display a lot (hiding features like buildings is a nice touch). Map panning and zooming performance has improved on my device recently, and the issues I have with the app now are kinda nitpicks.

The biggest issue I have now is that road names are sometimes not displayed, especially for smaller side streets. This can make on foot navigation annoying at times. In addition, osmand on iOS tends to display municipal road numbers for state, county, nat‚Äôl highways, but not local road names as they are posted at intersections. Oftentimes highways are tagged with both the municipal number (ex. cr 18) and a local or alternative name in the OSM, and I‚Äôd love to see this reflected in osmand.

One other issue I‚Äôve had is with the street name indicator not displaying at the top of the screen, even though street name is enabled in the configure screen menu. An app restart usually causes this to display again. this does make it difficult to figure out what road you‚Äôre on from the app when this issue occurs.

Big props to the developers - this app is really useful and has helped me out a lot. A true competitor to google maps that keeps getting better over time, and is based on open data :) It‚Äôs always nice seeing the edits I‚Äôve made show up on osmand.

Pretty disappointed to be honest. How do I stop this? | Useful in so many ways and minus a few bugs I love it! Good job people!

title: GasBuddy: Find & Pay for Gas
description:
Join the 90 million people already saving! Get the free GasBuddy card and never pay full price at the pump again. See how GasBuddy gives you more ways and more places to save on gas than any other app.
 
Pay at the pump
Get the free GasBuddy fuel card and save on every gallon, at any station. No hunting for deals. Just securely link your bank account, swipe, and save up to 25¬¢/gal. Manage your account right in the app. 
 
Find gas
Find the best prices with the gas map. Sort by price, location, and the important stuff like restrooms.

Track driving habits
Drive smarter with tips and tricks to use less gas.

Get gas rewards
Turn your daily purchases into free gas. Just shop in the app and start earning. 

Report gas prices 
Give fellow drivers a heads up on the latest deals. 

Log your fill ups
Track your gas use and export the log for reimbursement and taxes.

Stay safe
Be the first to know about important recalls for your car. 

Win gas
Complete challenges in the app to earn points. Use points to enter the daily prize draw for a $100 gas card. 

Disclaimer
GasBuddy uses gas price information provided by our users to bring drivers together to support the common goal of saving money on gas. Gas prices only for USA & Canada. Apple Inc. is not a sponsor of the prize draw.
releaseNotes: Continued bug fixes and performance improvements.

Especially for an app that‚Äôs supposed to be used at quick intervals, this really bothers me for some reason. 

Oversimplifying it I‚Äôm sure, but in React Native, add this to the info.plist and it should unlock refresh rates above 60Hz. GasBuddy seems pretty well optimized‚ÄîI'd be surprised if there were issues. 

<key>CADisableMinimumFrameDurationOnPhone</key><true/> | I drove to a gas station with a 22 cent discount. I started the activation for this discount only to get a message after telling me I could have saved over $4 if I used the discount! Seriously! It was activated and instead of a almost $5 discount I was given 33cents. How can it deactivate if I just started the timer?

title: been
description:
Keep track of countries and US states that you have visited, and if you wish, also when you visited. The app visualizes the visited countries both as a list, along with a ratio for each continent, and as a world map. The map can be shared on social networks, such as Instagram, Twitter and Facebook, using the standard iOS sharing functionality. You can compare your map with friends that also have the app, by sharing your map with them.

- If you miss the old look of the app, you can enable Classic Mode to get the old experience back. We hope you will like the new experience though, as we will continue to improve it.

PREMIUM MODE

There is a Premium Mode in the app that you can unlock, if you wish, by a single ONE-TIME In-App Purchase. It unlocks all features in the app.

Features unlocked with Premium Mode:

- In addition to states and regions in the US, with Premium, you can select regions in 25+ countries.
- Select cities and airports.
- More 3D globe filters.
- More visualizers, such as a chronologic map.
- Add local profiles, to allow for multiple maps and country selections.
- More detailed comparisons with more information.
- Share your timeline as a video.

CONTACT US

Feel free to give us feedback by email or on Twitter or Instagram. Our username on Instagram and Twitter is @been_app. Email address available in Contact section in the Profile tab in the app.
releaseNotes:
- Fix for crash on iOS 17 when achievement is unlocked.
- Other small iOS 17 fixes and tweaks.
reviews:
I love using this app and tracking my travels. Please add Easter Island as a part of Chile. | I came back to this app because I went to New York for the first time and the state map was gone. I don‚Äôt care about countries because I‚Äôm poor and hate flying | It‚Äôs a great app for users to use. The design and content are really great. | I liked the new update a lot. Although, I think there should be more country regions added. Plus, I think percentage of a country‚Äôs regions should count not on dependent territories, but actual regions (who plans on visiting Navassa Island anyways?). Also, the UK glitch should be fixed (the app kicks you out whenever you click on UK). | Tried a search for Egypt and Cairo and nothing came up for either. | Will update to 5 stars when you fix the horribly wrong Michigan border | I‚Äôve been using the App for years and am very fond of it.
My only complaint is you can no longer see Antarctica along the bottom of the world map.  But, at least it‚Äôs there in the globe‚Ä¶ | Love the app, however I‚Äôve been to multiple countries in a single month and was hoping there will be an update to rearrange them in order of my travels Add Antarctica to the map Change the UI of the globe so we could zoom/ move the globe around via touch screen instead of the sliding bar Add chronology option to the iPad, it seems to be missing | Please add more achievements!! | I enjoy using this app but it counts countries in a strange way. Not sure why it‚Äôs based off UN recognised countries. We all know they are useless and not sure why we would think their list is useful. This app use to be much better, hopefully they get it together. | A couple issues: the globe isn‚Äôt zoomable (there‚Äôs a Mercator projection that is) and the timeline feature is very frustrating. If I went to more than one country in a month it chooses the order for them with no way that I can figure out to manually order (so it will often show up not chronologically) | I doubt this will ever get seen lol but this app is awesome! I love the concept, however I wish there was a setting to separate the US by states. | The application is amazing, although Georgia is located in Eastern Europe and Western Asia. Not an Asian country. Please correct in the application | I love being able to visualize my travels, but I hate that Antarctica doesn‚Äôt show up on the maps! | Please and I mean please add more pictures to the explore page and when you click on cities/regions for a country give it its own little page because i love to use it for my travels. | Lots of QOL fixes should be put in, being able to zoom in on the map, adding countries quicker, and some new features. However i paid for premium thinking my friend and i could both keep track together. Instead the ‚Äúcomparison‚Äù feature is a one-time comparison that you have to do ad hoc. Each time I tap on search nothing happens. The screen simply says I have no saved countries.  I Went to see if there was a video available with instructions. There is one but its in German. I just wasted $2.99 and most importantly 30 minutes of time. By the way Mexico is not in North America. | Why is the map so big now it used to be right size now it shows Greenland üá¨üá± being giant | I‚Äôve use this app for years & love the new features. I would LOVE if you could track National Parks as well! Just traveled to two in Croatia and would love a way to track them. | Been has gotten way better in recent updates. I love it and with the upgrades bought the upgrade. One ask is to show a view of my airport locations on a map, and at some point my cities. | I love the Been app. It‚Äôs perfect for me. But I‚Äôm dying for a macOS version. How about it? | I love the Been app, and the overhaul update makes the app so, so much better.

A few suggestions:
- Add currencies
- Make it a bit easier to edit visits

Love the app! | I used to like this app about a year ago. It was super simple and I can easily see what percentage of the US or the world I‚Äôve been to. Now it‚Äôs so hard to do anything. Features were added that were pointless and get in the way of the concept the app used to be. Deleted. | I really enjoy traveling and tracking where I‚Äôve been so really like this app. But I would like to go back and add info about timing of my past trips and can‚Äôt find a way to do that.

Also, for Oceania, it correctly shows that I‚Äôve been to Australia and French Polynesia and on the bottom it lists 2 countries, but in the summary it just shows one. Also it just has a short list of cities and no way to add the various islands we visited.

I‚Äôd there is a way to fix both, please let me know. | I think an option to keep track of all the counties you‚Äôve visited would be a great option, on the national and individual state level. | Love that this was updated with many features.  But UI isn‚Äôt good at all.  So challenging to use.  I can‚Äôt find where to see a photo of all the US states Ive been to.  Where did that go?  Please simplify the interface. | This app used to be so simple and so easy to use. There was a recent update that totally ruined the experience. I‚Äôd recommend trying out another app because Been is now too difficult to navigate. | This app used to be so amazing until they updated it :/ | Terrible, not intuitive | Was a good, simple app before the update. Now it‚Äôs got a horrendous UX/UI. Not intuitive and also classified countries incorrectly? Just weird. Unusable now. | I love this app so much, but lately I opened the app i saw a premium version that i can add cities where i have been.
I push button 'unlock premium' many times and nothing happen. Please fix it. Thank you | I used to love the app to update the states I‚Äôve been to. I just opened the app to add Idaho and it took me a few minutes to find where to add it. I‚Äôm really disappointed because I liked the Simple App. | I‚Äôve been using this app for years. It WAS great. Simple, intuitive. Now they‚Äôve over complicated it with all the added junk. | Where is Antarctica? | Really disappointed. Used this app religiously when traveling the past 4yrs and this last update put basic functionality behind a paywall. Look else where. | The new update with the paid version is a huge improvement. I highly recommend getting it for anyone interested in more detail to their tracking of countries, airports, cities, and so on and so forth. | Checking in on the app mar 2023 and all my data seems to be gone. The many places I entered months ago now gone. I‚Äôve got no confidence that entering it all in again won‚Äôt again cause it to be flushed. When there was data it was not properly categorized. I‚Äôd had entered many cities I‚Äôd lived in and visited. But the ‚Äúmy regions‚Äù report shows 0 entries? That is a problem. If one have to enter all of the data many times once for city, then again the region eg state explicitly ? And I‚Äôll agree the classification is wrong. For example there is no way the various subdivisions of say American Samoa are the same as a single US state. Samoa as a whole would be on the same political subdivision as a US State. All of the US Virgin Islands would be at the same level as a US state. Individual districts or islands may be on the level of US counties within the states. This indeed makes the statistics mostly misleading and meaningless other than in the context of the app - ie pointless. Finally , why are all cities that exist in a map not storable as a visit in the app? Eg Chugwater Wyoming USA. Is are the cities actually manually curated in a table in the app? Not just loaded from a UN data file?

And finally the visualization , while I had it. Unless I‚Äôm missing something ,  viewing countries as all or nothing is not helpful. So if one location in the USA was visited the entire USA is colored in on the map?   The globe/map visualization should have a ‚Äúdetail‚Äù level one can turn on to specify which view of data to visualize. Eg Country Level (what we now get) , next lower (state / territory/region) , and maybe next lower (county, district , prefectures etc). 
This way someone looking to visit all of one country can get more meaningful visualization. | Why did you remove Antarctica from the map? I enjoyed seeing it when I looked at the map of countries I‚Äôve been to :(. Otherwise I love the app, been using it for years. 5 stars except you took Antarctica off the map :( | The old version was so clean and simple now it isn‚Äôt user friendly | Love the new look and functionality of the app. Really embraces the travel log elements in a way that Foursquare once did many years ago. My one note would be to see if the Timeline view can be extended to states/territories as well. For people traveling more domestically (in whatever country that may be), it‚Äôs a helpful view that tells a cool story for you and/or friends. | I don‚Äôt know why people have bad reviews about this app!  I think it‚Äôs amazing! | The first airport I tried to load required premium upgrade. | Great update | I loveee this app. But I‚Äôm wondering if there can be some connection between Apple devices? I have to update the same info from my phone to my iPad every time and I think seamless syncing through maybe your iCloud account would go so far!  Love it though. Especially the new update. Even paid for the upgrade and I check it out all the time. I‚Äôm a perpetual backpacker so this is super helpful! | love the app but its not syncing across devices through icloud. also would be even better with mac/watch support and face/touch id | Flag mode should include the option to incluse places such as Taiwan and Kosovo. otherwise it‚Äôs great. | I used to love the simplicity of this app. Now after the update there‚Äôs too much going on and took away the good stuff. | I used this app for all my travels across the world. Then they changed the app and added so many features. Complicates it all. 

They added all the provinces to my 50 states checklist, making it nearly half what states I‚Äôve been to, if this was to be fixed, I will change my update to 5 stars bc it was a great app. | I‚Äôve used this app for years to keep track of the countries I‚Äôve been to, and it‚Äôs always simply done the job. I just noticed the most recent update, and it seems SO cool. It adds the ability to check off territories, cities, and even airports. Love it. Great work!

title: Turkish Airlines: Book Flights
description:
Are you ready to discover the World with Turkish Airlines privileges? Our mobile application helping you to experience the best travel experience speeds you up by remembering your selections and flights. You can use our application to benefit from features making your life easier such as reservation, ticketing and check-in.


USER-FRIENDLY DESIGN

‚Ä¢ Either a vacations or a business trip, it now a lot easier to plan your travel! Our mobile application remembers your selections, likes and flights and makes recommendations exclusive to you.

‚Ä¢  We have created a new design focused on the ideal user experience. Now, you can easily make your travel plan, ticketing and Miles transactions. 

‚Ä¢ Thanks to our easy to use application, you will buy tickets, arrange your reservations and view your registered flights a lot faster.


BRAND NEW DISCOVERIES

‚Ä¢ Get ready to discover the world with the  airline operating between the most points of the world.  By viewing the special offers, you can fly with advantageous prices.

‚Ä¢ By viewing the city guides, you will get to know about our recommendations that will color your travel. You prepare for an enjoyable travel by checking out the places to visit, the tastes to savor, airport transfer information and more for the cities you will visit.


RESERVATION METHOD

‚Ä¢ You can make your reservation later by saving your flight. You can finish the payment whenever you want on all of your devices.

‚Ä¢ From My Reservations section, you can add a new flight, you can change or cancel your flight and add infants to your flight.


FAST AND SECURE PAYMENT

‚Ä¢ Among various payment methods and currencies available on our mobile application, you can select the most convenient ones and make payments easily.

‚Ä¢ You can buy tickets a lot faster by saving your credit card or scanning your card with the camera at the payment stage.

‚Ä¢ You can always feel safe by hiding your credit card and profile information.


MILES&SMILES PRIVILEGES

‚Ä¢ We have developed a personalized Miles&Smiles experience exclusive to our mobile application. You can enter to your account with your finger print.

‚Ä¢ You can get an award ticket or shop on Shop&Miles by using your Miles.
 
‚Ä¢ Now, Miles transactions are much more extensive! Transactions like buying Miles and transferring Miles can be carried out on our mobile application.


ADDITIONAL SERVICES

‚Ä¢ You can make reservations from any hotel you like and save time by renting your car before your travel with special prices or using your Miles. 

‚Ä¢ If you wish, you can buy a travel insurance to take precautions against unexpected events during your travel. 

‚Ä¢ In order to maximize your comfort, you can fly in the seat you wish by selecting your seat.


DETAILS MAKING YOUR TRAVEL BETTER

‚Ä¢ It is now a lot easier to buy tickets for your travels including multiple flights. Just click on the multi-city selection.

‚Ä¢ You can follow the status of any flight you wish by using flight status feature. 

‚Ä¢ Before your travel, you can view the location of counters, cafes, restaurants, pharmacies and more on the maps with the uploaded airport maps.
releaseNotes:
Thank you for using the Turkish Airlines mobile app! Our new version includes the following important improvements:
‚àó You can easily renew your Miles&Smiles password by entering your membership number.
‚àó You can check-in and view your mobile boarding pass by adding Siri shortcuts to your phone.
‚àó If there are changes to flights booked with award tickets, you can quickly set new travel dates.
‚àó You can view flight information and your mobile boarding pass on your Apple Watch and quickly board the aircraft by scanning the QR code on your watch at the boarding gate.
‚àó With bug fixes and design improvements across the app, you can enjoy a better user experience.
See you in the skies!

title: RV LIFE - RV GPS & Campgrounds
description:
RV LIFE is the app where wanderlust and wisdom intersect. It's a place to share experiences and inspire confidence to conquer the adventure ahead.

Trusted by millions of RVers, RV LIFE helps you locate the perfect campgrounds, navigate your RV safely, and journey with confidence. Install our free app today to elevate your RV adventures and join our thriving community of trusted RVers.

Crafted by RVers, for RVers: As RVers, we've experienced the limitations of car-based GPS apps and the frustration of needing an app to work when you are offline.

Designed specifically for RVers (sorry, tent campers), we've developed an RV-specific platform for researching, trip planning, navigation, maintenance tracking, and more. The most important features of our app, our campground directory, and map plus the GPS‚Äô turn-by-turn directions function offline in remote locations with no internet.

Customized RV GPS Navigation and Safe Routes: Our GPS navigation, customized for your RV's height, length, and weight, ensures you avoid low clearances, hazardous mountain passes, and inappropriate guidance that comes from using car-based GPS services. Enjoy turn-by-turn, offline directions, voice navigation, lane guidance, and real-time traffic alerts.

The Unrivaled Authority in RV Park Directories: For decades, we have been the go-to directory for RVers. Explore every RV campground, RV park, and RV resort, easily accessible through our intuitive map-based interface. With over ten million data points derived from firsthand insights from fellow RV travelers, we provide you with the highest quality data to ensure you are informed during your travels.

Our specialized RV park database offers in-depth information relevant to RVers, such as campground amenities, internet speeds for gauging cellular coverage, feedback on sewer and water connections, lot spacing, tow vehicle parking, etc.

Confidently navigate knowing you have access to world-class data crowdsourced by verified RVers. Gain insights, such as things to do, places to eat, and other advice, from fellow RVers who've journeyed there before you.

Our RV-focused filters simplify the process of finding well-rated, popular RV campgrounds. You can search by type (National Parks, KOAs, BLM, etc.) and RV discount (Good Sam, Passport America, AAA).

Insider RV Tips from Fellow RVers: Take advantage of RV tips offered by other RVers, covering topics like RV area attractions, top dining options, and more, accessible from any RV campground's detail page.

Pro members have access to our celebrated trip planner, RV LIFE Trip Wizard. Plan your itinerary from any browser, then easily access your trips from our app, ensuring safe navigation to your next destination. The trip planner operates in a browser, facilitating convenient planning from your laptop, tablet, or phone.

Save More with RV LIFE Pro: Turn your phone into a reliable, RV-safe GPS and save money by upgrading instead of purchasing an expensive RV GPS device, complete with offline, turn-by-turn navigation.

Browse Thousands of Articles: RV articles covering topics such as RV destinations, RV DIY projects, helpful RV hacks, RV product reviews, and more.

We're fortunate to boast over 20,000 five-star reviews from satisfied RVers who trust RV LIFE to guide their journeys. 'We use this app for everything! Love the reviews and the opportunity to learn from other campers. We've not been disappointed when finding campsites on the road. Easy to use.' - Teachr1990

Our biggest achievement isn't that major media outlets like the Washington Post, BBC, Forbes, and USA Today have sung our praises. Our real badge of honor comes from the feedback of our fellow RVers. RV LIFE is frequently featured on RV blogs and YouTube channels. The respect and trust we've earned from the RV community and the media alike‚Äîthat's our north star. Let's hit the road together.

We love feedback and suggestions (please don‚Äôt be shy): Email support@rvlife.com
releaseNotes: + Resolved the issue with inaccurate distance data on the Trip Overview screen.

This GPS routes me perfectly. | This app is great for planning trips and learning more about the RV Life. With steady updates, this is my go to for trip planning. | I have been using this app for just over a year and I really do like the planner/wizard. Easy to find places you are looking for, good at alerting where gas stops are required. Even the ‚Äúhow far I will drive in a day‚Äù areas are super helpful. But then there is the navigation when on a trip. Yes, it will give you a safe route. Yes, in general it will get you where you are going. This past trip, southbound on I-95, we got the ‚Äúuse the left lane to stay left‚Ä¶take exit on right in 550 ft‚Äù. That exit on the right was 4 lanes over, not possible. It‚Äôs one example but stuff like this happens all the time while using it. 

I still use it to plan but I manually add stops into google maps to track the same route. I hope the navigation gets better over time! | $65, really? | I just updated the RV Life app on my iPhone. When loading my trip it says my first leg from Ohio to Iowa is over 24,000 miles. They broke the app. | Your app does not show the whole trip. Your website when it lets me sign in works great. | My family has been in a crunch time trying to find an RV park that will accommodate our needs. Although we haven‚Äôt found anything yet due to the parks being at full capacity, this app has been extremely helpful filtering out what we don‚Äôt need and the map gives a clear view of what‚Äôs around locally. | I have been using this app for a year and CarPlay is dated need more improvements. | GPS is un-useable. Too bad as everything else is great. I‚Äôll be back when they fix it | I don‚Äôt see a Help menu on this app. I use this app on an iPad and iPhone. I just entered five stops for a trip and I couldn‚Äôt find a Save button. When I opened Trips again only one stop was saved. I do not find this app User Friendly | Navigating this app with changing screens and prompts that make no sense.  I have uninstalled it. Good riddance. | first time using it going to FL and back home. It brought us all over the place and on a road that WAS NOT RV safe when the path states RV safe. We had no choice due to on a one way road and we ripped off part of our AC unit on our roof. I do not recommend this app. | Has anyone had to utilize RV for life, if so what has been your experience?

Thanks 

Theresa | Love app for camp ground research and trip planning.  However, the gps has been hit or miss for me. Very often I‚Äôm taken down very out of the way routes through small towns with some really tight turns and then I find a route that stays on main roads almost right to my destination. So be sure to sanity check your routes or be ready for the potential to learn some new towing skills. | There isn‚Äôt a way to create a new trip in trip wizard.  Somehow I created one a few months  ago, but now there is no option to do so.  Totally useless. | I have found this app to be easy to use & find many options for places to stay. Thank you to developers & all the places to review. | The GPS has taken me several times and areas of construction that really are just dangerous for trailers. If you look around there are alternate bypass routes for vehicles over 10 feet I know the trailers aren‚Äôt over 10 feet but when you start getting into these construction zones with real tight spaces it gets dangerous. | Carplay need some work. NO lane guidance and the map can not be changed from top view to 3d view what makes it very difficult to see when you are approching an exit to identify in which lane you need to be depending on which side you are turning after taking the exit.  I emailed the company about this months ago and they responded that they know about it and they are working on it and here I am still waiting for that update and I am a PRO account. | We‚Äôre moving cross- country and are relying on the app daily to help locate good RV parks, plan trip routes, calculate mileage. It‚Äôs indispensable! | I bought the RV Life subscription to get rv safe mapping and can use the maps and other features. But when I hit Trip Wizard and try to use that, it sends me to the page to purchase a subscription. Is this right? | The app is good but not great. Many times it told me to make a uturn on 2 lane highway, that doesn‚Äôt work well with a 38 ft coach. Also there is no traffic avoidance like waze has. | The concept is amazing but the UI is too complicated and frustrating.  Needs a redesign from the user perspective of simpler is better. | The application promised to show gas stations that are suitable for RV in the paid version. In fact, the application shows all the gas stations, even the small ones, that you can't go to the RV. | When leaving Missoula this app routed us right into a extremely dangerous and costly situation.  Routed us directly through a 13‚Äô overpass as ‚Äúsafe route‚Äù.  It was not as our 5th wheel is 13‚Äô 4‚Äù.   I screamed and we hit the brakes!  We had to back up traffic to escape.  Needless to say we were shook.  
I placed several calls and sent emails to let them know, they never commented or replied. 
Horrible and dangerous! | Planning a route from Pennsylvania to Ohio.
Using the RV trip planner GOS wants to route me up across Interstate 80 or down across Route 68 with both routes taking well over 8 hours. ( I did not have TOLL ROADS turned off) Would not even let me select the Turnpike.
So, Planned the route on my Garmin 890 and it took me across the PA turnpike which is 6 hours.

Sooo, FORGET RV TRIP WIZARD. USED the GARMIN! | I wish the GPS would stop sending us into stressful and sometimes even dangerous situations. No, I will not make a U-turn with my trailer, and I would also prefer not to go down narrow residential streets. It would be great if these options could be turned off. Other than that, useful app. | Not a bad AP for RV routing but the GPS needs to be updated with more features such as a choice of vocals for directions as the robot voice gets a bit old. Live traffic data, more than one map version, points of interest, etc‚Ä¶.
Sometimes data is missing on the map even when I have downloaded the state I am in. It can be a little finicky and not a fluid experience with delays when you start rolling it takes a while to catch up. Sometimes it states that the route is not RV safe and needs to be verified, well is that not why I purchased the AP? How do I verify if it‚Äôs RV safe? With a better AP? | Been full time for a year now.  Hit 39 states and used the planner for all of it.  That part of the app is fantastic.  It‚Äôs the gps that needs a lot of work.  Doesn‚Äôt tell you what road you are on, doesn‚Äôt show how far to the next maneuver or what the next maneuver is or how far to the final destination.  Gps is garbage!!!! | This is one of the worst apps I have truly ever used in 25 years as a traveler and software engineer. It bounces you between the web and the app and often freezes in the process. The password management is atrocious. When they can‚Äôt manage correct credentials- they simply lock you out and tell you to setup another one. The mobile app (which I am trying to use as a Pro member) is worthless. I am using Google Maps because the RVLife interface is cluttered with useless features that simply get in the way. Don‚Äôt even get me started on how difficult it is to set up a trip! 

These people advertise aggressively and everywhere and I fell for it. Just simply a frustrating, buggy timesink of an app with slick marketing. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend to my worst enemy. (Actually- I would. It would be amazing revenge of a sort.) | Started the free trial and on the very first trip, this app took us down a dead end gravel road so bad we suffered damage to our fifth wheel that will probably cost me around  $1,000 to repair. Not only have I cancelled the app, I‚Äôd really appreciate some support from this company on covering the repairs. | Save your money and only use the free features. The GPS is terrible. Google Maps is way better. | Updated app while on way home during trip. It changed next route and added almost 200 mi to next destination but cant figure out why. Customer service was not of any assistance. They did mention that some people were experiencing difficulties after the update but did not offer any compensation for the extra costs we incurred on our cross country trip. 
We also had prior issues where the gps did not route us on safe roads. 
Unfortunately we have loss faith in this app, their customer service and their developers. 
Because of this and their no seeming to care attitude we will be reviewing other apps and programs and not renewing this subscription. | The app is great for planning but not very good when driving. Not enough advance warning before turns or changes of roads. | This app is a great resource for traveling and finding campgrounds! | This app is impossible  support stinks. | After four years of safe RV travel to 47 of the lower 48 states and 5 Canadian Provences using Google Maps we finally had a problem with ‚ÄòLow Clearance‚Äô.  In navigating the New England States we found ourselves traveling south on I-95 from CT to New Jersey. I picked the fastest route that Google suggested and found ourselves on the Hutchison Parkway in New Rochelle, NY with a 10‚Äô6‚Äù trailer and one 9‚Äô6‚Äù underpass after another. 30 minutes later we joined the big truck parade through NYC. Which leaves to Part 2 of this tale.

I checked around at various truck/rv routing apps and decided that the GPS function in RV Life was easy  to use and already on my phone, and better yet worked with CarPlay. Just to try it out I searched for ‚ÄòWhole Foods Market on N.Pottstown Rd‚Äô. The search provided an option which we followed down a variety of narrow, but ‚ÄúRV Safe‚Äù roads to an empty field. Lesson learned. Unlike Google Maps this GPS doesn‚Äôt have any idea about things like grocery stores. It had taken us to ‚ÄòN.Pottstown Rd.‚Äù But nowhere near the WF‚Äôs. I suppose of I had used a street address I may of had better results. | This app worked great for our trip through Nevada, Utah, and Idaho.  But it really wanted to send us on 5 right through Los Angeles traffic on the way to Disneyland instead of 210 to 57.  Very frustrating that we had no way to select that as an alternate route!  Another trip to Casini Ranch on the Russian River it totally sent us a very sketchy way and luckily we made it in 1 piece without slamming into trees or the rock wall.  Some lady was walking her dog on that road and we almost took both of them out.  Scary!  We don‚Äôt trust this app anymore at all. | Have used this for 2.5 years. It has taken me on roads I should not be on. I now compare their gps to google maps. Bad bad bad gps for pulling a camper.  Otherwise, this app is great for finding campsites. | Directions would take me off the interstate just to go back up the same ramp..  when on the interstate it would not say or show if you needed to go N-E-N-S when you are merging onto another interstate. Ended up going back to google maps‚Ä¶ | Overall concept is great.  But trying to schedule a trip planning event is not as easy as it should be. Your would think Starting at point A to go to point B should be easy. Get the start A but point B is not shown to enter. Tried multiple times different ways on different trips but still same results. Must be missing something but tired of trying. Plus required to pay whole year, even if cancellation you are not prorated and must wait until year is up. Big disappointment. Seems that there is a program problem for entry. | I don‚Äôt see how the navigation is much different from Google maps. With Google Maps you can avoid tolls and highways. It seems like the only other benefit to this app is that you can avoid tunnels, if that‚Äôs even accurate. I would‚Äôve thought that there would‚Äôve been a way for you to find gas stations that are friendly for trucks with travel trailers or large motorhomes. You could go to a truckstop, but I‚Äôve been to truck stops that have spaces for trucks but then the fuel is diesel only. I don‚Äôt see much advantage in the reviews because they don‚Äôt get very detailed. And you can find many more reviews of whatever campsite you‚Äôre looking into on Google maps then you can on this app. If the app was free, then I say it was great. But if you want me to spend $65 a year you need to offer much more than Google Maps does. And this app does not. | The speed limit displayed on the GPS screen is often wrong! Driving in a posted 45 zone the app showed 65 as the speed limit! 
Instead of having me continue straight across  a highway, the instructions said to turn right then make a u-turn, then turn right and get back on the road I was on! 

This update needs work! | I have read other reviews about Mac troubles. I too am using OS 12 on my iPad, latest OS on my phone, and occasionally on a Mac laptop. I would like to make my iPad primary but I am having trouble loading an earlier version - that‚Äôs not RV Life‚Äôs problem. I love the ability to search campgrounds as we go, on the map feature. I started using this because it is where RV Campground reviews moved. Good app, it is my go to when traveling. | We use RV Life to plan our trips and appreciate all of its features.  If you have an iPhone and your Rig has CarPlay,  RV Life works perfectly !!!  I have one suggestion, if RV Life could add a RV fuel pump option.  I noticed that some fuel stations have stand alone pumps just for RVs or small trucks.  Maverick Gas in Durango Co is a great example.   Hope you can add this feature some day!   We love RV Life!!!

title: Japan Travel - Route,Map,Guide
description:
Japan Travel by NAVITIME will help you travel around like a local!

App Overview:
-Explore (Travel guides/articles)
-Route Search
-Map / Offline Spot Search
-Plan

About the Features:
[Explore]
-We provide you with basic guides and informative articles about traveling in Japan, written by foreign autohrs residing in Japan.
-Topics include transportation, money, internet connection, food, art&culture, nightlife, shopping, etc.
-Recommended itineraries are also provided for areas throughout the country.

[Route Search]
-The app navigates you from your preferred point of departure to your destination.
-Search covers all modes of public transport (trains including JR and subway lines, airplanes, taxis, and ferries).
-Provides useful information such as the platform number, station lists, and timetables. 
-Search directly from a zoomable interactive map of the Tokyo area.
-Allows you to save up to 50 recently searched routes. You can also see them while offline.
-The Japan Rail Pass mode will show the most efficient route for pass holders.

[Map / Offline Spot Search]
-Search offline for the following spots: Free Wi-Fi hotspots (NTT FREE Wi-Fi, FREESPOT, Starbucks, etc.), currency exchange spots, ATMs, TICs, and train stations.
-Book hotels, rental cars, and activities nearby you or your destination.

[Plan]
-While reading articles or searching on the map, add spots to your favorites that sounds attractive. 
-Create your own travel plan with your favorite spots by adding them in a timeline. Your plan can be also viewed on a map.
-Comfirm the transportation information directly from your plan. You can select modes of transportation like train, taxi, walking, local buses, etc. 
-Start your planning from our recommended itineraries, and coordinate it by adding spots from your interests.

[Itinerary] (New!) 
- Search, create, and share travel itineraries. Search from +200 itineraries created by our Editorial Team, as well as by other users. 

[PAID Features]
-Search alternative routes in case of a disruption to your searched route.
-Voice navigation will show you directions and landmarks.
-Check the rankings of articles to know the hot topics.
-Make more collections and sort out your favorite spots.
-Rain & snow radar will show the forecast up to 6 hours ahead.

*Notice:
-This app uses GPS in the background for the purpose of enhancing user experience. You can turn the GPS off from Settings on your device.
-Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.
-At the time of your initial access, we ask users to participate in a survey for the Japan Tourism Agency, which is aimed to enhance tourism experience in Japan. This survey is optional, and you will be able to use the app without answering them.
releaseNotes:
Ver5.7.4
- Point release
reviews:
Too many ads and limited navigation. Google Maps has better navigation info | I just downloaded the app on iPhone 14-  I signed up and registered and also verified my email info and clicked yes for location access on my phone-  then I got a blank screen- I tried turning my phone off- the app just gives me a blank screen when I open it on my iPhone-  frustrating- made me feel like this was a potential scam to give access to my phone | Anything worth using cost money. Might as well use Google Maps for free. | This could have been a good app if it focused on its rail timetable and planning strengths.  Instead, it is cluttered with distracting and irrelevant offers and information for things one can search and find in a dozen other better content sites.  This obscures and undermines the rail planning function which could have made the app uniquely worthwhile.  It is not a question of paying for ad-free premium, it‚Äôs a question of app focus to do one thing well instead of ten things poorly. | I can get it to login perfectly on an iPad, but it keeps saying that the password or email is incorrect when I try to login via my phone. | Despite having an expensive subscription service, it is LOADED with ads. The home page of the app is a landing page for advertisements. It will constantly send you push notification ads. The directions are marginally better than Google/Apple maps, it‚Äôs 100% not worth it. | We had our own passes purchased direct from JR Rail so it was not very useful. Seemed ‚Äúmarketing heavy‚Äù to encourage purchases for other tours. | Does not show route maps! Even for paid version. Don't waste your money. Travel instructions lack clarity. One good feature: it *will* tell you when to leave Point A to arrive at Point B, at a specific time. Other than that, Google maps is far easier to use, plan, & view your route while you're traveling. | We had some events pre planned and I can‚Äôt add them. They only show you booking through them. I can find the routes etc, but definitely not worth the money if you just need help with some stops. | Great app when it was free | Latency is bad. Itinerary function is confusing and useless. | This app is great, but‚Ä¶..  it always deletes my saved train routes. I live and work in japan, and it‚Äôs very annoying when I look to see what train I can take, and it deletes ALL my saved routes. To the point I have to save them all over again. This has happened multiple times. | I‚Äôve never been to Japan before, don‚Äôt speak Japanese. Planned my whole trip using this, paid for premium, it‚Äôs worth it!! Would not have been able to get around the subways without it. | Haven‚Äôt been able to get it to work from day one!  Deleted it and found something else. | I‚Äôm trying to use the Osaka subway route map and it ‚Äúcan‚Äôt find‚Äù any station I‚Äôm trying to search for.  Useless! | ‰π±Êâ£Ë¥π | I used to love this app, but they‚Äôve made some very questionable changes lately. Seeing the station list used to be free, now they‚Äôre making you pay for premium to look at it. I‚Äôve also seen a bunch more popups bothering me to upgrade. I‚Äôll be using a different app from now on. | We traveled most of Japan and found google to be better. Navigation seemed hard and it didn‚Äôt seem to come up with interesting things to do. 
I struggled to find the right trains to get on and just gave up as it was easier in google. I found the app a waste of money. Shame I had high hopes. 
Third visit to Japan with rail pass and three kids. | Just the free portions of this are worth 5 stars. The routing system is a must when traveling. The platforms, changes, and times were spot-on. This made a 2 week trek around Japan by rail east. | Fails immediately. Continues to fail as you struggle to use it. Paid for upgrade but no upgrade was applied. Use google maps. It‚Äôs better and it‚Äôs free. | This is a great rail app for free. I was using the other japan official app but it wasn‚Äôt showing my JR trains effectively, so i switch to this one and gets my planned and reserved trains. You can use both if you need to but if you want a one and done than this app is it. | I‚Äôm unable to pick other bullet trains it just defaults to one | I have been using this app for years now, and it has been very helpful as a resident in Japan. With one of the more recent updates, they started to really push the paid plans. This took features that were free and monetized them. The station list for my route is no longer viewable which was great for tracking my time. 
In addition, they hide the cost of the premium plan to get you to buy it easier. Very sad.
I will be looking for a new app to use. | Have been using the app all over Japan for the past two weeks and it has performed flawlessly. The information is accurate, detailed and reliable. It is easy to use and has lots of great features, like letting you create a menu of your hotel names and addresses so you can quickly search for the best route to or from wherever you‚Äôre staying. You can also easily filter searches by whatever pass you may have and/or type of transportation you prefer to use. If you‚Äôre traveling around Japan on your own itinerary, you‚Äôll want to have this app. | Great info on train times and routes but I wanted the navigation feature. Even with my pocket wifi it never worked. No turn by turn, no voice prompts, and it was very laggy. Wish I could get my $20 back. We ended up using Google maps. Not only was it more up to date but it tells you which entrance and exit to use. It even suggests which car to use for the fastest exit! | This shows the proper routes with Japan Rail Pass.  Google Maps won't work since it's always showing non-pass routes.  Great app. | The routing is okay but misses several available trains which is a big nono (didn‚Äôt get the thunderbird JR booked for me and which Google maps happily suggested), the interface is clunky, but most annoyingly despite having paid $14.49 for a (30 days!) premium I still got ads in route planning. What the heck Navitime?!? | This is a great app for someone visiting Japan as well for people living here. You get all the shopping information from electronics to clothing shops and their discount and taxes save. I haven‚Äôt try the Navi drive yet. I hope it will save me a lot of time from using google map which usually take me to all the alleys in Japan before my destination. I like the train directions of this app. | This app was a godsend during our trip to Japan! We used it constantly, so helpful to find the right route, especially with it telling me if the route would be covered by my JR Pass. HIGHLY recommend downloading if traveling to Japan. | I would love the app but it will not let me but a subscription no matter how much I try, which severely limits my ability to plan my trip. | This app is absolutely indispensable for travel within Japan on the rail, subway and bus systems. The search results are clearly laid out with station numbers and your particular track information. Apps like Hyperdia are GROTESQUELY complicated in comparison. 

Couple this app with a WiFi hotspot ( I used Japan Wireless) and you will never be lost. I‚Äôd give it 10 Stars if I could. | Best app among all the navigating apps I downloaded and tried out while in Japan. The most helpful feature was that it would tell you which train to take (on a JR Pass), which station to catch it, what time it would leave, and the track that it leaves from. Now if only someone would develop an app to guide you through the
maze of underground tunnels and shopping corridors to find the right exit close to your hotel. | Tried finding train route from Tokyo to my resident city, Tsukuba, Japan, but the app gave me wrong information. I have taken this route dozens of time using the excellent Hyperdia website. But this app not only gave me a bad route, it could not even find the Tsukuba train station. Tsukuba is the Japan Science City and the second biggest city in Ibaraki Prefecture, so this is shameful. Do not get this app. instead, use the Hyperdia website. | If you need a navigation, how to get around japan, guidance on how to take the train this is it for you. I love this app. | One of the best applications I‚Äôve ever used. It always works with no issues. I‚Äôm planning my trip and this app gives me ideas where to go and what to see. Definitely will use it in Japan. Absolutely love it! | The amount of information given in this app is wonderful. Location of a.t.m‚Äôs, money exchange, free WiFi, and closest stations is great. Travel route are better than the app that my native japanese friend has, with multiple routes to choose from and distinct JR pass routes. Estimation on how much non JR trains cost and taxi travel is spot on. I‚Äôve been to Japan several times and this app made this trip even easier. I utilized all its features on a daily basis. I thank the developers for a well thought out and very usable application. | If you love to travel your going to like this a lot üòÇüéÅ‚ô•Ô∏è | I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to do it here. It must be the best app there‚Äôs to travel using your JR pass. Has good routes, can optimize for JR pass, and even shows the platform numbers which is super useful. | Very smooth great for trains ferries even busses. I wish that there‚Äôd be English characters for busses so you can search for bus stops, also to be able to look up nearby busses, maybe add/incorporate stops. Also maybe even a biking route option. 

Finds places google maps doesn‚Äôt have. And is much easier to see all times that bus stop leaves as compared to google maps.

I use google maps just to get the name of the bus stop I need sometimes and plug that into this app or use the location of the bus stop. And I‚Äôm have reach my destination.

These would all be very cool extras. As it stands, this is a fantastic app. | Definitely your GO TO app for finding your train options. I used this over HYPERDIA app that others recommended. The app helped me in booking and planning my trips on the Shinkansen using JR rail pass. | It‚Äôs very accurate. It gives you the exact time and information of where to go. Now, I am an expert with trains! | Place I call, ‚Äúthe HOME of my SOUL‚Äù.

I was born near by town of Tomonoura.
A long long time ago! 
Went to the U.S.A. to explore my curiosities. Then found the freedom!!!!! Decided to stay! Got married. Two kids! Every trip I, we, made to my native land, Japan, our trip included Tomonoura!!!! Now my kids want to visit there as their pilgrimage! I feel so warm inside of the core of my heart when I get greeted by the sign saying ‚ÄúWELCOME HOME‚Äù. In Japanese!

There must be so many beautiful places to visit in Japan but Tomonoura will be one of the places you can enjoy Japan‚Äôs ONCE UPON A TIME! | Don‚Äôt buy the full feature. Navigation very difficult to follow and slow to update. Google maps worked better. This was only useful in finding train stations and platform. | I gave this app 3 stars because numerous times, the stores I wanted to find/shop at came up with no information. This is disappointing because they immediately appeared when I googled the same store name with all the information including a map and directions. 
While other portions of the app are fine, for me if I want to go somewhere and this app can‚Äôt even tell me it exists I‚Äôm sorry to say it‚Äôs usefulness is closer to a 1 star... especially considering I had to pay $7.95!!! | I used this for my week in Tokyo and it was amazing for getting you where you want to go. Would recommend. | ...I used an app called Japan Transit.

Notice the verb tense above. Japan Transit got deleted after I used this app for all of 5 minutes. Much more info available with this new app, so I am still learning, but it is still much better. | If you‚Äôre visiting Japan and don‚Äôt have this app, you‚Äôre doing yourself a disservice. 
The timetables and train navigation are fast, easy to understand, and accurate. It outranks other apps (including Google Maps) in almost every regard. | I downloaded this app ahead of my trip to Japan 4 weeks. I was messing with it for a few weeks and loved it. 

Now, the night before my trip, I opened it up and was confused. Where was my app? Did I download something else? NOPE! 

The update ruined it. And I lost all my saved routes in the update. Now it‚Äôs confusing and difficult to use. Shame! | As foreigner I find this app very useful to know how to get from one place to another, truly the best app I‚Äôve used for Japan Rail, subway, taxi, etc... very recommended | Seriously couldn‚Äôt have navigated around Japan without it.

title: Mahjong Journey¬Æ: Tile Match
description:
Embark on a magical journey in this addictive Mahjong Journey¬Æ adventure!
Enjoy a new take on Mahjong Shanghai as you help a young girl and her cat traverse the globe in search of her lost parents.  Make your way by pairing tiles in order to dismantle hundreds of layouts. Collect achievements for special accomplishments while taking advantage of innovative gameplay twists like Shuffle, which allows you to get out of a difficult situation, or Firecracker, a tool for blowing up multiple pairs of tiles. Visit the Forbidden City, Virupaksha Temple, the Taj Mahal and the famous Mount Fuji as you fulfill challenging quests and earn gold stars for completing levels as fast as you can!

While this game is absolutely free to play, you have the ability to unlock optional bonuses via in-app purchases from within the game. You may disable in-app purchases in your device settings.

If you like to make in-app purchases in this game, Mahjong Journey¬Æ also offers two absolutely optional auto-renewable subscriptions that provide substantial benefits compared to individual in-app purchases.
‚Äì In case you choose to sign up to Silver Subscription or Gold Subscription, the price will be $19.99 per month or $49.99 per month accordingly. Payment will be taken from your iTunes account for the first month when you confirm the purchase. In case you choose to subscribe, it will be automatically renewed each month unless you cancel it. Please cancel at least 24 hours before the end of the monthly payment period to avoid being charged for the next month.
‚Äì You can cancel your subscription at any time. Visit your account settings to upgrade, downgrade or cancel your subscription. Note that in case you choose to subscribe, the current payment period cannot be canceled or pro-rated.

You can play this game whether you‚Äôre offline or online.
____________________________

Game available in: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, Spanish (Latin America), Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Swedish, Russian, Korean, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese (Hong Kong), Traditional Chinese (Taiwan), Japanese, Arabic

releaseNotes:
EASTER EVENT ‚Äì Collect Easter Eggs and journey through new levels on the festive map. Earn exclusive avatars and improve your totem to receive amazing daily awards. Gather all the special event collections and win a unique Easter Fox Statuette, which gives you Firecracker and Undo boosters every day.
FIXES AND IMPROVEMENTS ‚Äì Your favorite game is only getting better. Check it out!

title: Flightradar24 | Flight Tracker
description:
The world's best flight tracker app - #1 Travel app in over 150 countries.

Turn your iPhone or iPad into a live flight tracker and see planes around the world move in real-time on a detailed map. Or point your device at a plane to find out where it‚Äôs going and what kind of aircraft it is. Download for free today and discover why millions are already tracking flights and checking flight status with Flightradar24.

‚Ä¢ Watch aircraft move around the world in real-time
‚Ä¢ Identify flights overhead & see flight information‚Äîincluding a photo of the actual aircraft‚Äîby simply pointing your device at the sky 
‚Ä¢ See what the pilot of an aircraft sees in 3D 
‚Ä¢ Tap on a plane for flight details such as route, estimated time of arrival, actual time of departure, aircraft type, speed, altitude, high-resolution photos of the actual aircraft & more.
‚Ä¢ See historical data & watch playback of past flights
‚Ä¢ Tap on an airport icon for arrival & departure boards, flight status, aircraft on the ground, current delay stats, & detailed weather conditions
‚Ä¢ Search and bookmark individual flights using flight number, airport, or airline
‚Ä¢ Filter flights by airline, aircraft, altitude, speed, & more
‚Ä¢ NEW - view aircraft in 3D with hundreds of new aircraft and airline liveries added.
 
Flightradar24 is a free app and includes all the above features. If you want even more great features from Flightradar24 | Flight Tracker there are two upgrade options‚ÄîSilver & Gold‚Äîand each comes with a free trial.
 
SILVER

‚Ä¢ 90 days of flight history
‚Ä¢ More aircraft details, like serial number & age
‚Ä¢ More flight details, like vertical speed & squawk
‚Ä¢ Filters and alerts to find and track flights
‚Ä¢ Current weather at 3,000+ airports overlaid on the map
 
GOLD
 
‚Ä¢ All the features included in Flightradar24 Silver +
‚Ä¢ 365 days of flight history
‚Ä¢ Detailed live map weather layers for clouds & precipitation
‚Ä¢ Aeronautical charts & oceanic tracks showing the pathways flights follow across the sky
‚Ä¢ Air traffic control boundaries that show which controllers are responsible for a flight
‚Ä¢ Extended Mode S data‚Äî even more information about a flight‚Äôs altitude, speed, and wind & temperature conditions during flight, when available
 
If you choose to upgrade to a Silver or Gold subscription, a payment will be charged to your iTunes account at the end of the free trial period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. Auto-renewal may be turned off at any time by going to your account settings in the iTunes Store. Silver and Gold upgrade prices are listed in the app as they vary depending on your country and currency. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

HOW IT WORKS

Most aircraft today are equipped with ADS-B transponders that transmit positional data. Flightradar24 has a rapidly growing network of 35,000 ground stations to receive this data that then shows up as aircraft moving on a map in the app. In an expanding number of regions, with the help of multilateration (MLAT), we‚Äôre able to calculate the positions of aircraft that don‚Äôt have ADS-B transponders. Coverage is subject to change at any time.

CONNECT WITH FLIGHTRADAR24


We love getting feedback on FR24. Since we‚Äôre unable to respond directly to reviews, you can contact us directly and we‚Äôll be happy to assist.
‚Ä¢ Email (support@fr24.com)
‚Ä¢ X (@Flightradar24)
‚Ä¢ Facebook (@Flightradar24)
‚Ä¢ YouTube (@Flightradar24DotCom)


DISCLAIMER


The use of this app is strictly limited to entertainment purposes. This specifically excludes activities that might endanger yourself or the lives of others. Under no circumstances will the developer of this app be held responsible for incidents resulting from the use of the data or its interpretation or its use contrary to this agreement.

Terms of Service: https://www.flightradar24.com/terms-and-conditions
releaseNotes:
We regularly update Flightradar24 in order to bring you the best flight tracking experience. In this latest update you'll find:
 ‚Ä¢ Bug fixes and performance improvements.
Enjoy using Flightradar24? Rate the app and leave a review!
reviews:
I am very interested in planes, and this is my #1 choice for tracking planes and locating my flights. It is accurate, and when I flew with my family, I was able to see our plane live and watch where it was to gain knowledge on when it would be ready for us to fly. I love the most tracked feature, so I can view rare planes. It would be nice to have a little more with a basic account, but it still gets the job done. So as I said, it would be nice to have a little more things to do with a basic free account. | As a retired pilot of 33 years with both FW & RW, I will forever look upwards to whatever is flying around. It‚Äôs cool to now see the From- To, type, and operation of aircraft nearby. Thanks for eliminating the questions of those identifiers. | I think this is one of the best apps I have downloaded on my phone | Love this app | There are some ads that are relatively mild and not disruptive (e.g. little banner images at the bottom of a screen) and there are other ads that go out of their way to be as disruptive as possible. Unfortunately if you choose the free tier of this app you are occasionally assaulted by the obnoxious ad types ( full screen blockers that you can‚Äôt dismiss until a minimum time has elapsed). The app developers could have use less disruptive ad types in the free product, but they prioritized profit and greed over being reasonable.  With inflation the way it is not everyone wants to shell out an extra $15 or $20 all the time for every little thing.  

If the irritating ad types were removed from the fee tier and only non-disruptive ads were used I would be very willing to rate this 5 stars. | I love following my kids when they travel. Thank you Flightradar for families. | Always a pleasure using this app to  track flights. Thanks | Very friendly app and very usefull | I am a flight attendant and generally love this app for both work & leisure. I have one small quibble, and I recognize there‚Äôs a good chance it might be something totally outside the developer‚Äôs control: when I try to use it on an airplane, the map is just a blank beige grid for a very, very long time. So I can track the flight I‚Äôm on, but for a very long time I have almost no clue where the plane actually is, because the map takes forever to load.

Again, I‚Äôm not an IT person so I fully recognize this is probably a limitation of the Wifi capabilities of the planes I am on, and thus beyond the scope of the app developer‚Äôs abilities to fix. Nonetheless, being able to see where the plane is on a map is a crucial aspect of this app‚Äôs appeal- and it usually works terrifically anywhere on the ground. But on the plane in the air, this capability is next to non-existent because of long it takes the map to load. I used to have an old phone and thought my old phone might be the reason for this. I‚Äôve just bought the newest iPhone, however, and discovered the same problem still exists. | This is a great app to watch planes it‚Äôs very accurate and addicting I watch this for hours I 100% recommend! | Sadly I cannot afford to fly anywhere, I love putting this app on & dreaming about the plane, where it came from, where is it going?  I day dream of all the people, I say a silent prayers in pilots name for safety of crew.  I‚Äôm living my Honolulu daydream that just flew over me & will be landing in Boston momentarily.    A girls gotta dream! | I love this app but lately it gets glitchy and insists on centering on whatever plane you tap on. It makes it very difficult to see the route because it keeps moving the map on me. | When in 3D view, if another aircraft is selected, the distance is noted. Can this be added to airports? It shouldn‚Äôt be too much work since the coordinates of the airports are known, just as they are for different aircraft. Thanks! | ü§ôüèºü§ôüèºü§ôüèºü§ôüèºü§ôüèº | I have been using this application for sometime now, and I find it invaluable. I want to thank the creators and the people who provided it. | I look on my airplane app to see which airplane is flying in to Washington DC or maybe they‚Äôre going towards Shenandoah area, I do enjoy watching‚Ä¶ | Great | Very much enjoy FlightRadar24. Suggest adding the following filters/triggers for custom flight alerts: - time to arrival - arrival or departure - in specified area already, not only when enters Time to arrival would be helpful as I enjoy plane spotting and can set an alert for a certain aircraft when it gets within an hour of landing at my airport. Also would appreciate the option to put airline logo above the text label for further customization.  Keep up the good work. | The app is nice, however when in 3D mode, it would be nice if the earth below had labels or a side map of the 2D so you can see where the plane is.  Also when you set an alert, you lose the ability to choose to see the flight, and then there‚Äôs no button to cancel the alert.  It took some time to get around that. | Flightradar24 is a W app but you can‚Äôt see certain planes and it‚Äôs really annoying please fix this fr24 devs | I had no idea that it also gives volcano notifications!!!BEST APP I‚ÄôVE HAD | –û—á–µ–Ω—å —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ 3D –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—è –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–∞ –±—ã—Ç—å –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–π | This app is insane | I‚Äôm pleased to leave a positive review about this app..it is accurate and indeed offers some level of convenience for me | Dunno | Excellent and accurate | Very good for plane spotting and just looking at planes | Very good | A friend shared this app with me and it quickly became my favorite app. I live near an airport and was always curious about which airlines or flights were flying overhead. Now that data is much more accessible. My only complaint is that the app uses battery life quickly. | Can you do 3D buildings | This is the way to go good Intel | Thnx | I‚Äôve used this app to track my daughter‚Äôs flights every time she has flown to Europe and currently as she flies to Hawaii. It‚Äôs so cool to watch the plan go over land and sea. I like that you can see what the pilot sees if you want to choose that perspective. Love that you can see what kind of plane. It‚Äôs amazing to see all the airplanes flying everywhere live‚Äîso many of them! | This is one of few apps I just have to have. | I use this almost every day | Plane plane plane plane plane, but souiriusly I hav an adicshin with plane so really cool, going spotting? Look at your airport departure and arrival board. How? Idk. I did it. It simple app, figure out easy, fun use I would have missed seeing a 747 but because plane app, I see. Cool make me want fly. title: Omio: Trains, buses & flights
description:
Omio: Plan, book, love the journey

Our pioneering and practical booking platform helps travellers worldwide explore Europe, the United States and Canada. With Omio, customers can compare trains, buses, flights and ferries in one simple search. Choosing Omio means saving time and money while loving the journey you‚Äôre on. 
-Our trip planner always helps you find the best ticket for your trip. Compare and book travel tickets in 37 countries (and counting!). 

Join the mobile travel revolution today‚Äîmore than 27 million monthly users have magical experiences with the Omio travel app, with 22 million app downloads to date. 

Explore different ways to travel

- Endless possibilities: Countless ways to find meaningful new journeys. 
- Skip the line: Waiting to buy paper tickets are a thing of the past.
- Book on the go: On-the-go booking so you can spend more time loving your trip!
- Safety first: We're dedicated to ensuring your journey is as safe and comfortable as possible‚Äîfrom mobile tickets to travel safety updates. 

Book all your tickets in one place

- All your travel options: The best train, bus, flight and ferry options that suit you.
- Transport companies you believe in: More than 1000 trusted transport companies you can count on to get you where you're going.
- Explore the continent and beyond: Travel seamlessly to thousands of destinations, from bustling cities in the United States to quaint towns in the European countryside and, even, Canada‚Äôs great outdoors.
- Exclusive offers: Exclusive offers you can't find anywhere else.
- Discount cards accepted: Save even more on your trip by using your bus or train discount cards.

Support you can count on

- Local response. International support: A customer service team that speaks your language, no matter where you are.
- Need a little more help? We have English customer service 24/7.
- Security. Privacy. Trust: Your privacy is important to us. All payments are secure (Apple Pay, PayPal, SOFORT, Alipay, credit cards, etc.).
- Live trip updates and platform info: Get live updates on the status of your SNCF and Italo train as well as trains in Great Britain and National Express buses plus important platform info for SNCF trains.

Our ever-expanding selection of partners includes most transportation companies in Europe, the US, and Canada!

‚Ä¢ Trains: Amtrak, National Rail, LNER, Deutsche Bahn, Eurostar, Italo NTV, NS International, Renfe, SBB, SNCB, SNCF, Scotrail, Thalys, Trenitalia, Via Rail

‚Ä¢ Buses: ALSA, BlaBlaBus, Eurolines, Flixbus, Go Buses, National Express, Ourbus, Redcoach, Rede Expressos, RegioJet

‚Ä¢ Flights: Air Canada, Alaska, American, Delta, easyJet, Eurowings, Frontier, Hawaiian, JetBlue Airways, Porter Airlines, Ryanair, Spirit, United, Vueling, WestJet, Wizz Air

Contact
How can we help? 
Need to change, cancel or alter your plans?
Our customer service team is only a call or email away.
Email: apps@omio.com
help.omio.com/hc/en-us
releaseNotes: Update your app to avoid being bugged by reduced speeds! Omio is now faster, better and stronger.
reviews:
Only vertical on iPad. Using iPad Pro with keyboard is thus not possible. | I use Omio often and the actual ticket always comes in right away. 

I booked a train from Kaiserslautern to Paris and I paid extra for a first class seat. The ticket was never delivered electronically like normal. I got an email and the app also said to ‚Äúuse the yellow machine to get your ticket at the train station‚Äù there is NO yellow machine in Kaiserlautern and the customer service is DB and was unable to help at all. 

I had to sit on the floor for over 2 hours due to this. When the ticket people finally came by they had to look my ticket up by my passport. By then I was unable to go to the seat due to having a bag. 

I tried and tried to get help online but it was only a virtual assistant, which is zero help. Over 100 for this also | Finallly, an app I can rely on for all my transportation needs in Spain & Italy.  Super easy to use and see precisely the best means, times, and price. | Me encanta | Can‚Äôt access tickets and there is zero customer support | why will this app not give me English American currency US dollars instead of giving me pounds? | So convenient and helpful. | I have tried multiple time to buy a train ticket form this app but everything I find a price that‚Äôs reasonable it up charges $50 because of ‚Äúprice changes‚Äù but then when I close and reopen the app the ticket prices have not actually changed form what was first advertised.

Update: The developer told me this was a connectivity issue. I‚Äôm not an app developer so I can‚Äôt comment on that but all I know is I tried on multiple different days both at home and on my school Wi-Fi. So do with that as you will. | The app and the website has been crashing (closing) anytime I try to manage a booking. I have a trip coming up at the end of the month and this is frustrating. I have to contact customer support instead of using self service options available on both platforms. | Thank you to all the programmers and visionaries for building this tool!  We love its ease of use, clear options, and details.  Sincere thanks! Kathy and Todd USA | I used to use this app more often but then they changed the name of the app and I can never remember it. No support for horizontal view if you‚Äôre on a iPad, very annoying. | Very well done app. Super easy and powerful. | It gives a good idea of trips. Be aware that you can‚Äôt plan bus trips far ahead. And train traveling through Germany is so crappy (100% probability of missing a connection) that it shouldn‚Äôt even be offered as an option. 

Hopefully in the future they can add some flexibility, e.g. date -1 or +1 (now you have to make a new search), and location (nearby cities as an alternative). | I searched for trains for May 10th of this year, but the app gave results for May 5th. I didn‚Äôt realize this until after my tickets were already booked. I canceled my reservation the same day, but am being charged a fee to do so. It‚Äôs incredibly deceptive to search a specific day and be given results for 5 days prior. The app should say ‚Äúno trains available.‚Äù Be wary of doing business here. | I payed money but no ticket sent to my email | Omio won‚Äôt be able to provide tickets ahead of the trip, but only a confirmation number which security and customer service won‚Äôt accept or help, and it‚Äôs a mess to get on the train. The fact that Omio didn‚Äôt give clear instructions for getting the barcode ticket is to blame, and it‚Äôs a shame. | You can all the passengers in advance. | Update; the replied and didn't help me. Don‚Äôt seem to care their app is broken. Needed a refund and the app crashed repeatedly. Tried to use the contact page and it gave me an error over and over. Tried to contact customer service via chat and they tried their best to avoid letting me talk to a person, who then denied the refund because it had been more than 30 minutes‚ÄîBECAUSE THEIR APP WAS BROKEN. Truly disgusting company. | More expensive in app than online | Upon trying to enter my credit card information, an error occurred and my credit card wasn‚Äôt accepted.

This alone isn‚Äôt a very big deal, but afterward I was not allowed to pick the option for entering my credit card information again. It was just grayed out and it didn‚Äôt work when I tried to press it, just to make sure.

Instead, I could only select Apple Pay or PayPal, which I never use.

If it wasn‚Äôt for this, I‚Äôm sure this would be a decent app to use. | I have tried to buy train tickets for our Spanish trip several times - each time I had to fill out details of 4 persons and each time at the very end I got the message ‚ÄúThe tickets you selected are sold out. Try again‚Äù. I lost 30 minutes, so I gave up and bought the tickets on the train company‚Äôs app - much more efficient. And tickets were available without any problems. | Using this app has been a horrible experience for my husband and I. We booked a flight through this app and then the airlines service canceled our flight. It has been six months and we have still not been issued a refund. Omio says they were waiting to hear back from the airline, but they have not done anything in the meantime to issue a refund. This is extremely poor customer service, and I do not trust this app anymore. I do not recommend this app at all, I would book directly with airlines and transportation companies and not use a third-party servicer as this has been an extremely frustrating and disappointing process. I have no trust that I will be issued the refund for a flight that was canceled outside of my control. | Mostly useless tbh | Booked ticket a day in advance and they oversold the bus. It‚Äôs not easy so the best thing I thought was to buy tickets online. I am currently traveling throughout Bulgaria and Turkey and was happy to think my tickets were taken care of. I was wrong. 

I arrived at the bus station in Sofia to travel to Plovdiv. The Arda Tur agent that contracts with Omio did not have any buses for my ticket time and date. Wow. Now what? I had to buy a ticket from another firm. 

When I arrived to Plovdiv, my next stop was Turkey and then back up to Bulgaria which included two more tickets purchased online. Also NOT VALID. I had to rebuy tickets to Turkey and back up to Bulgaria for completely different times which throws my schedule off completely.

I will never use Arda Tur or Omio online ever again. If I was a tourist that did not understand and speak a little Bulgarian I would have been royally screwed.
